Custom company description:
Saudia Aerospace Engineering Industries (SAEI) is a world class full-service Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) organization, the leading MRO in Saudi Arabia and is one of the largest and most experienced MRO in the MENA. SAEI is wholly-owned by Saudi Arabian Airlines Holding. SAEI’s head quarter and main base is located at King Abdul Aziz International Airport (KAIA) in Jeddah in Saudi Arabia.
SAEI’s main base facility in Jeddah accommodates wide body aircraft up to B747-400 and B777, with future planned expansion of maintenance hangars capable of accommodating A380 Aircraft.
SAEI has been the right technical arm of Saudia that provides its full maintenance support to Saudia fleet. SAEI is also providing its services to Saudia’s affiliates and to several other major local, regional and international airlines.
SAEI today is backed by over 59 years of experience and more than 4,500 highly qualified and trained professional workforce, 90% of which are Saudi nationals. SAEI offers an extensive array of integrated maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) services to civil and military aircraft owners and operators, both locally and abroad.
SAEI is an ISO 9001:2000 certified organization. It is renowned for its quality services and safety standards. SAEI holds several aviation authorities’ approvals including GACA, FAA, EASA, CAACI & IOSA to provide airframe, line, engine, and component maintenance services.
SAEI currently has the capability for repair and overhaul a large portion of aircraft components including aircraft engines and Auxiliary Power Units (APU’s). SAEI facilities are equipped with ATEC 6000 test computers and have a standalone engine shop that handles various types of aircraft engines and APU’s.
Simply … the right choice …
For more info visit our website

We are developing innovative tech solutions at Pegasus Airlines to keep ahead of the curve, crafting a seamless travel experience so impressive that it leaves passengers saying, 'That’s brilliant!'

Custom company location: Airways Company Building Al Dajeej Area Safat Jileeb, Al-Shiyukh, Farwaniya, Kuwait
Custom company description:
Kuwait Airways (KU: IATA, KAC: ICAO) is the official national carrier of the State of Kuwait.
 
On the wave of the oil boom of the 1940s, a national carrier was born in 1954. Initially, Kuwait Airways Company served a limited network of Basra, Abadan, Beirut, Damascus and Jerusalem; however, a year later the fledgling carrier was facing economic hardship, and the government of Kuwait took a 50% interest in the airline, subsequently doubling the company's capital. Having entered the rough and tumble world of aviation, the government finally took 100% share in Kuwait Airways.
 
Kuwait Airways entered the jet age in 1962 by leasing a Comet 4-C, the world's first jet-engined airliner. In the 1960s, the national carrier rapidly expanded its route map, and scheduled services to London began three times a week. To keep pace with fast-moving aviation requirements, three Boeing 707s were delivered in 1968. Ten years later, Kuwait Airways had an all Boeing 707 fleet of eight aircraft. 
 
In 1978, Kuwait Airways entered the wide-body age by taking delivery of its first two B747-200s, adding a third the following year. This expansion permitted Kuwait Airways to extend its network to New York to the west and Manila to the east. 
Modernization of the fleet continued, and four B727-200s were delivered in 1980-1981. Two years later, eight Airbus A310s and A300-600s were delivered, and in 1986 three Boeing 767-200ER aircraft joined the wide-body fleet.
 
Following the destruction of its premises and 15 of its aircraft during the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait, the airline was relaunched. Moreover, the company was restored after the Liberation of Kuwait, and a basic strategy was constituted to expand its operations around the world. After the Liberation of Kuwait until 1998, the Kuwaiti Airways fleet consisted of 17 aircraft.
 
In 2016, the airline was formally registered as a private company and its Corporate identity was rebranded to reflect its modernization and transformation.

Custom company description:
A joint venture between Rolls-Royce and SIA Engineering Company, Singapore Aero Engine Services Private Limited (SAESL) stands as one of the world’s largest Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) facilities for Rolls-Royce Trent engines. Currently, approximately 25% of the world’s Rolls-Royce Trent engines pass through SAESL, propelling aircraft such as the Airbus A330, A350, and A380, as well as the Boeing 787 Dreamliner.
Since its establishment in 2001, SAESL has become an indispensable component of the Singapore aerospace ecosystem, catering to airline customers across six continents.
In line with our commitment to innovation and meeting growing demand, we are thrilled to announce a major investment of US$180 million to expand our facilities and integrate advanced technologies. This strategic move will increase our capacity by 40% and position us to capture the burgeoning engine Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) demand in the Asia-Pacific region and beyond.
This investment underscores our dedication to providing top-tier services to our global clientele while contributing to the continued success of the aerospace industry. We are confident that these enhancements will further solidify SAESL's position as a leader in engine MRO services and drive even greater value for our customers and partners worldwide.

Pursuant to the Concession Agreement between GLS and the Government of Liberia; ratified into Law by the House of Legislature on July 11, 2017, and further assignment to GLS-NAS Inc., GLS-NAS is the exclusive service provider of cargo warehousing, freighter handling services and ramp handling of cargo. 
Under the terms of the agreement, GLS - NAS will design, finance, build, maintain, operate and transfer (DFBMOT) a new, modern cargo facility at the Roberts International Airport (RIA) in Monrovia. This new facility will improve RIA’s air cargo operations to meet international standards and support export supply chain capacity in the country. 
 
The new storage facility will cover a ground area of approximately 2,700 sqm.  Other equipment improvements, including upgrades to current operating systems and capacity as well as certifications and capabilities to handle all forms of cargo under the International Air Transport Association (IATA) scope, will be also be made. 
Once completed in 2019, the facility will also be equipped to handle special cargo, such as perishables, pharmaceuticals, minerals, vulnerable goods, dangerous goods and hazardous materials. The facility will also have a dedicated freighter parking to support time efficient operations.

In the early 1980’s, Kuwait airways identified the need for a separate company to undertake many of its ground handling functions. In addition, the provision of a flight kitchen operating to first class international standards at Kuwait International Airport was seen as essential for the future growth of the airport. Kuwait Airways therefore established in 1981 a wholly owned subsidiary Kuwait Aviation Services Company (KASCO) - to meet these needs.
The kitchen established by KASCO was only the first brick that has grown bit by bit into such a huge company designed especially to meet the needs of its customers. Today, after more than thirty year of operation, in addition to its flight kitchen, KASCO is operating Kuwait International Airport’s restaurants and cafeterias, supervising the First Class and Business Class Lounges (Dasman), overseeing V.V.I.P. services, and managing the food and beverage operation of the airport transit hotel.
KASCO started providing catering services to local market under the name of KASCO Gourmet. This project specializes in providing catering services, such as buffets and banquets, as well as meal plans for individuals, private institutions, and some governmental sectors. We also focus on providing V.I.P. and V.V.I.P. privileges and services to our customers.
As another indication of KASCO’s aim to widen its activities, KASCO has established the Hospitals Catering Services in 2003, Our catering service provides reassurance to our clients that meals are of the highest quality and provenance to ensure, the maximum satisfaction of their patients, visitors and staff.

Custom company location: Mumbai, Maharashtra, India
Custom company description:
Drone technology is leaving a revolutionary impact on the Agriculture industry of India, successfully increasing its efficiency. At Airbots, we offer drone-powered solutions to farmers assisting them to increase productivity in crop monitoring, pesticide spraying, treatment planning, plant growth monitoring, precision farming, scouting, and much more.
AirBots' advanced drone technology and machine learning for Precision Agriculture results in better crop yields and profitability. Correspondingly, lower levels of standard input from the farmers are required to grow crops and maintain land, water, fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides.
We combine UAV Aerial Imagery with Machine Learning systems for Crop yield forecasts, accurate crop count, crop emergence analysis, irrigation monitoring, crop health, crop damage assessment, field soil analysis & more. High-quality drone data and photogrammetry guard crops to guarantee productivity and equip farmers with all accessible benefits.

Former Position: Retired Group Captain of Air Force
Custom company location: House Block F Road  11 Banani 50, Gopalganj, Dhaka Division 1213, Bangladesh
Custom company description:
NOVOAIR established in 2007 with a vision of “Excellence in Aviation’’ and the motto “ART of Aviation’’, which emanates from the conviction that NOVOAIR shall endeavor to provide the best of service to valued clients. We are committed to upholding On-Time Performance, Safety, Services and Comfort to our passengers. Over the time NOVOAIR has become the number one choice of air traveler in the country.
We are operating scheduled flights to domestic airports namely Chhattogram, Cox’s Bazar, Jashore, Sylhet, Saidpur, Barishal and Rajshahi with total 6 (Six) aircraft on our fleet ATR-72-500 aircraft, which is the best of its kind considering regional routes. NOVOAIR now connected with Kolkata an international segment and soon will connect to Guwahati and other regional destinations to enlarging footprints.
NOVOAIR has a pathfinder role in the aviation landscape of Bangladesh and introducing modern travel tools, paperless ticketing and the first frequent flyer program “SMILES” among any Bangladeshi airlines in domestic routes, meaning Smile, Safe, Superb, Satisfactory & Services through “Miles’’ with the conjuncture word “SMILES”.
NOVOAIR aspires to reach the highest level of customer’s satisfaction through an uncompromising commitment to safety, reliability, efficiency and stringent adherence to regulatory compliance. We have earned customer’s preference and employee trust through leadership, commitment and service. We invest our profits in people & services to grow. Our mission is to provide safe, reliable and friendly air services in partnership with our customers, suppliers and the communities we serve. One of our goals is to set ourselves the pinnacle of standards and we deliver on our promises.
NOVOAIR is committed to uphold On-Time Performance, Superior Services, Safety and Comfort. NOVOAIR, country’s “Best Domestic Airline” adjudged by “Monitor Airline of the Year”, becomes passengers first choice for air travel.

Custom company location: 60 Airport Boulevard, 819643, Singapore
Custom company description: The Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) is a statutory board under the Ministry of Transport. It provides air navigation services in the Singapore Flight Information Region. It represents the government of Singapore in the negotiation of air services agreements as well as advises on matters related to civil aviation. The organisation regulates and spearheads the development of civil aviation and plays a key role in making Singapore a global air hub.

Custom company location: Jakkur Aerodrome Bellary Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560064, India
Custom company description:
Deccan Charters Private Limited (DCPL) is one of India’s largest General Aviation Services Company providing a complete suite of solutions ranging from Corporate Travel to Aircraft Management, Maintenance and Technical Services. Deccan operates a fleet of over 17 aircraft (12 Helicopters and 5 Fixed Wing) from over 15 operational and engineering bases giving it the largest geographical footprint among aviation companies in the country. Deccan currently operates from Bangalore, Bhubaneswar, Chennai, Hyderabad, Jammu, Kolkata, Mumbai, New Delhi, Pune, Raigarh and Surat.
As part of its engineering and maintenance services, Deccan Charters maintains over 60 aircraft and hosts the Bell, Sikorsky and Eurocopter Customer Service Facility (CSF). It is the only helicopter operator in South Asia to be given the privilege by Bell Helicopter Textron. The Bell CSF, benchmarked to global standards and adjudged in the top 10 world-wide, is capable of repair & overhaul of major components and assemblies of most models of Bell helicopters in the country. 
In January 2010 we entered into an agreement with Sikrosky Aerospace to be the CSF to Sikorsky S76C++ range of helicopters in India. Recently, in 2011, we also partnered with Eurocopter to be their authorized Customer Service Center (CSC) for their helicopters. 
Deccan is an ISO-9001-2008 company certified by TUV-SUD. 
Deccan, in association with its service offers Powerfly, India's leading Jet Card Program. Powerfly combines the aircraft, aviation and hospitality expertise of Deccan Charters to provide a one stop, nationwide, flexible program that allows our customers to travel on their schedule on a comprehensive fleet of aircraft ranging from jets to turboprops and helicopters.

Custom company description:
Lion Air Group adalah perusahaan yang bergerak di bidang industri penerbangan dan membawahi beberapa jenis usaha yaitu; maskapai penerbangan, fasilitas perawatan pesawat, sekolah penerbangan, logistik serta usaha lain yang berhubungan dengan bisnis penerbangan.
Lion Air Group telah memesan 743 pesawat dari perusahaan pembuat pesawat yaitu Boeing, Airbus dan ATR. Melayani penerbangan domestik di Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand juga dengan penerbangan internasional.
Lion Air Group yang menaungi beberapa maskapai yaitu; Lion Air, Wings Air, Batik Air, Lion Bizjet, Malindo Air yang berbasis di Malaysia, dan Thai Lion Air yang berbasis di Thailand.
Ekspansi bisnis yang agresif dan inovatif membuat Lion Air Group kini telah memiliki sarana dan fasilitas yang lengkap guna menunjang bisnis penerbangannya seperti adanya pusat pelatihan, pendidikan, perkantoran, dan tempat tinggal bagi ground crew maupun flight crew, serta pusat perawatan dan pemeliharaan armada pesawat yaitu Batam Aero Technic.
Untuk terus memperluas jaringan usahanya, Lion Air Group pun membuka bisnis dalam pengiriman paket maupun dokumen yaitu Lion Parcel dan perhotelan yaitu Lion Hotel & Plaza yang berlokasi di Manado.

Cargo iQ: Visibly Better
Cargo iQ is an IATA interest group with the mission of creating and implementing quality standards for the worldwide air cargo industry. 
We operate as a not-for-profit membership group supported by IATA and composed of some 80 major airlines, freight forwarders, ground-handling agents, trucking companies and IT solution providers globally.
Cargo iQ members have developed a system of shipment planning and performance monitoring for air cargo based on common business processes and milestones. As part of that system, the Master Operating Plan (MOP) describes the standard end-to-end process of transporting air cargo.

Custom company description:
The first aviation company in Saudi Arabia and second in the Middle East, Mukamalah Aviation Company Limited (Mukamalah) was established in 1934 under the name of Saudi Aramco Aviation with the core mission of oil exploration through the vast Saudi desert. From its headquarters in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, Mukamalah operates more than 60 aircraft from different fleets all serving different purposes but with the common goal of helping in the business’ success.  In addition to its massive fleet, Mukamalah regularly serves 18 airports throughout Saudi Arabia, nine of which Mukamalah fully manages, serves, and operates, and more than 300 helipads, both on and offshore.
We provide charted business flights to corporate clients and all interested organizations. We have a diverse fleet of nearly fifty jets that serve different purposes and cover geographical areas impossible to reach by land. Additionally, we manage nine, and operate from eighteen, airports across the Kingdom, and reach more than 300 helipads. In 2023, Mukamalah’s pilots logged 51,437 flying hours with an average 97% on-time takeoff rate. 
Mukamalah proudly provides passenger and cargo transport, medical evacuation, geological surveying, and search and rescue missions, maintenance, repair and operations just to name a few. Mukamalah has been able to carry out all of these services since 1934, with an exceptional safety and reliability record, which would not have been achieved without achieving globally recognized safety standards.

Custom company description:
CHC provides unmatched helicopter services that enable our customers to reach beyond – to work in remote and challenging destinations that limit others – and come home safely. We are dedicated to our purpose of getting our customers where they need to be, when they need to be there, anywhere in the world – safely and reliably.

We are a trusted and reliable offshore transportation partner enabling oil and gas customers to safely reach beyond boundaries to explore and develop in some of the world’s most isolated, deep-water sites. We have decades of experience flying people to and from offshore platforms and vessels in challenging conditions in the remotest environments.

For more than five decades, CHC has been providing Search and Rescue (SAR) in challenging and hostile environments – from remote, perilous, and extreme terrains to offshore rescues in the towering swells of the Arctic Circle and the North Sea, the vast Atlantic Ocean, the cyclone-prone tropical waters of the Timor Sea, both sides of the Indian Ocean, and the Caspian Sea.

Heli-One, our maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) segment, is a global leader in providing these services in support of a range of helicopters. Decades of expertise and excellent, long-standing relationships with leading global helicopter manufacturers make Heli-One the premier rotor wing MRO solution. 

CHC is headquartered in Dallas, Texas, and operates a fleet of aircraft in countries all around the world.

Cargo iQ is an IATA interest group with the mission of creating and implementing quality standards for the worldwide air cargo industry. 
We operate as a not-for-profit membership group supported by IATA and composed of some 80 major airlines, freight forwarders, ground-handling agents, trucking companies and IT solution providers globally.

Pursuant to the Concession Agreement between GLS and the Government of Liberia; ratified into Law by the House of Legislature on July 11, 2017, and further assignment to GLS-NAS Inc., GLS-NAS is the exclusive service provider of cargo warehousing, freighter handling services and ramp handling of cargo. 
Under the terms of the agreement, GLS - NAS will design, finance, build, maintain, operate and transfer (DFBMOT) a new, modern cargo facility at the Roberts International Airport (RIA) in Monrovia. This new facility will improve RIA’s air cargo operations to meet international standards and support export supply chain capacity in the country. 
 
The new storage facility will cover a ground area of approximately 2,700 sqm.  Other equipment improvements, including upgrades to current operating systems and capacity as well as certifications and capabilities to handle all forms of cargo under the International Air Transport Association (IATA) scope, will be also be made. 
Once completed in 2019, the facility will also be equipped to handle special cargo, such as perishables, pharmaceuticals, minerals, vulnerable goods, dangerous goods and hazardous materials. The facility will also have a dedicated freighter parking to support time efficient operations.

Jetstar branded carriers operate up to 5,000 flights a week to more than 85 destinations. The Jetstar Group carried more than 37 million passengers in financial year 2018.
Our mission is to offer all day, every day low fares to enable more people to fly to more places, more often.

Custom company location: Solitaire Corporate Park v 502, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400093, India
Custom company description:
Founded in 1993, Allied Aviation has grown to become a leading General Sales and Service Agent (GSSA), synonymous with excellence in air cargo logistics. Guided by the visionary leadership of our founder, we strive to be a global leader by providing seamless, innovative, and sustainable solutions.
With over three decades of experience in capacity management and handling more than 10,000 tons of cargo annually, Allied Aviation has established itself as a trusted partner in the industry. Our comprehensive services span yield management, customized sales strategies, capacity planning, back-office support, full charter services, and complete end-to-end cargo management.
At Allied, we believe our people are the core of our success. We operate on the principles of Trust, Transparency, and Togetherness, which form the foundation of our continued growth and success.
By embracing innovation, leveraging advanced technology, and utilizing strategic foresight, Allied Aviation has transcended the traditional GSSA role to become India's premier cargo hypermarket, addressing the evolving challenges of the aviation industry.

Contact HQ Address 1: Airways Company Building Al Dajeej Area Safat Jileeb
Custom company location: Airways Company Building Al Dajeej Area Safat Jileeb, Al-Shiyukh, Farwaniya, Kuwait
Custom company description:
Kuwait Airways (KU: IATA, KAC: ICAO) is the official national carrier of the State of Kuwait.
 
On the wave of the oil boom of the 1940s, a national carrier was born in 1954. Initially, Kuwait Airways Company served a limited network of Basra, Abadan, Beirut, Damascus and Jerusalem; however, a year later the fledgling carrier was facing economic hardship, and the government of Kuwait took a 50% interest in the airline, subsequently doubling the company's capital. Having entered the rough and tumble world of aviation, the government finally took 100% share in Kuwait Airways.
 
Kuwait Airways entered the jet age in 1962 by leasing a Comet 4-C, the world's first jet-engined airliner. In the 1960s, the national carrier rapidly expanded its route map, and scheduled services to London began three times a week. To keep pace with fast-moving aviation requirements, three Boeing 707s were delivered in 1968. Ten years later, Kuwait Airways had an all Boeing 707 fleet of eight aircraft. 
 
In 1978, Kuwait Airways entered the wide-body age by taking delivery of its first two B747-200s, adding a third the following year. This expansion permitted Kuwait Airways to extend its network to New York to the west and Manila to the east. 
Modernization of the fleet continued, and four B727-200s were delivered in 1980-1981. Two years later, eight Airbus A310s and A300-600s were delivered, and in 1986 three Boeing 767-200ER aircraft joined the wide-body fleet.
 
Following the destruction of its premises and 15 of its aircraft during the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait, the airline was relaunched. Moreover, the company was restored after the Liberation of Kuwait, and a basic strategy was constituted to expand its operations around the world. After the Liberation of Kuwait until 1998, the Kuwaiti Airways fleet consisted of 17 aircraft.
 
In 2016, the airline was formally registered as a private company and its Corporate identity was rebranded to reflect its modernization and transformation.

Custom company location: Jileeb Po Box 301, Al-Shiyukh, Farwaniya, Kuwait
Custom company description:
Pursuant to the Concession Agreement between GLS and the Government of Liberia; ratified into Law by the House of Legislature on July 11, 2017, and further assignment to GLS-NAS Inc., GLS-NAS is the exclusive service provider of cargo warehousing, freighter handling services and ramp handling of cargo. 
Under the terms of the agreement, GLS - NAS will design, finance, build, maintain, operate and transfer (DFBMOT) a new, modern cargo facility at the Roberts International Airport (RIA) in Monrovia. This new facility will improve RIA’s air cargo operations to meet international standards and support export supply chain capacity in the country. 
 
The new storage facility will cover a ground area of approximately 2,700 sqm.  Other equipment improvements, including upgrades to current operating systems and capacity as well as certifications and capabilities to handle all forms of cargo under the International Air Transport Association (IATA) scope, will be also be made. 
Once completed in 2019, the facility will also be equipped to handle special cargo, such as perishables, pharmaceuticals, minerals, vulnerable goods, dangerous goods and hazardous materials. The facility will also have a dedicated freighter parking to support time efficient operations.

Custom company location: King, Khalid, Riyadh Region 11131, Saudi Arabia

Established in 1983 and located in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia Al-Atheer Aviation is a successful, professional and thriving private company.  Our business portfolio is growing and diversifying and includes providing the highest standard of VVIP Air Travel with our fleet of 3 VVIP aircraft, Operations & Maintenance services. 
Al-Atheer’s vision is focused on being the business leader in the VVIP air travel market place.  By skilfully combining professional excellence, business integrity and the uniqueness of our Saudi culture we offer an individual service to our discerning clientele. 
Our Mission is built around the 3 core values of Business Integrity, Service Excellence and People.  Our business conduct is beyond reproach, we strive and achieve the highest levels of service and we realize that none of this is possible without recognizing the value of our employees and their contribution to our success.  The mission is further underscored by the functional attributes of safety, efficiency, reliability, trustworthiness, hospitality and competence; attributes which define Al-Atheer and give us the competitive edge in the Kingdom and further afield.

Custom company location: 101 Ganpatrao Kadam Marg, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400013, India
Custom company description:
At Akasa Air, we believe that the Sky embraces everyone, and so air travel should be inclusive and affordable for all. A robust air transportation system that connects people, cultures, and regions will help our nation soar. This belief motivated us to  a dependable and affordable airline that everybody can relate to. 
We are India’s newest airline, and we launched our first commercial flight on 07 August 2022 to support the growing demand across India with the greenest and youngest fleet in the country.
Warm & efficient customer service, reliable operations, and affordable fares are the cornerstones of our brand promise. This promise is powered by our youthful personality, employee-centric philosophy, a tech-led approach, and a culture of service.
Akasa Air is helmed by a highly professional and experienced leadership team whose sights are set on the Sky while having their ears to the ground. Our team has laid a foundation of an organisation that listens, understands, and anticipates our customers’ needs. What’s more, we are committed to building an airline that’s socially responsible, economically sustainable, and inherently empathetic. 
These are exciting times. We look forward to welcoming you onboard Akasa Air. 
It’s Your Sky!

Custom company location: 26 Chemin De Joinville, Geneva, 1216, Switzerland
Custom company description:
Travel fuels the world today. Connecting us all. Building a better quality of life, and propelling our global economy. 
 
Since the start, we’ve made it our lifework to build solutions that help every airline and every airport across the world. We made check-in easier. We let pilots talk to ground control. We delivered better ways to track down lost bags. Some of our solutions even contributed to the birth of the early internet back in the 1970s. We’ve been innovating for almost a century. Defying boundaries. Bringing our industry together. And that’s just the beginning. 
 
We’ll keep building connections that bring our fragmented industry together. And we’ll keep using those partnerships to deliver better solutions. This is what drives us. We don’t just build networks. We make paths between your customers and their best travel ever.

Cargo iQ: Visibly Better
Cargo iQ is an IATA interest group with the mission of creating and implementing quality standards for the worldwide air cargo industry. 
We operate as a not-for-profit membership group supported by IATA and composed of some 80 major airlines, freight forwarders, ground-handling agents, trucking companies and IT solution providers globally.
Cargo iQ members have developed a system of shipment planning and performance monitoring for air cargo based on common business processes and milestones. As part of that system, the Master Operating Plan (MOP) describes the standard end-to-end process of transporting air cargo.

Custom company description: Acumen is an aircraft asset lease manager with a global platform, established in 2009, headquartered in Ireland with offices in India, China and the USA. This includes Acumen’s state-of-the-art asset management ERP platform, SPARTA, as well as its digital success advisory (DSA), offering specific software development and design solutions to help clients meet the challenges and requirements of the digital age.  Its customers include aircraft lessors, airlines, banks, private equity and investors.

Varman Aviation Private limited was established during 1994, initially as Stockists and Distributors of Aircraft spares and materials duly approved by Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA), Government of India. VAPL has ever since successfully supported the Aviation Industry in India by providing efficient MRO services.
VAPL houses the country’s first Aero-Engine Overhauling Shop in the private sector to overhaul Piston as well as Turbine Engines at its premises in Export Promotion Industrial Park, Whitefield, Bangalore. It was started by individuals with years of experience in the Aviation field.
At VAPL we have a fully computerised well-furnished administration office, a sprawing 45000 sq.ft. Aero Engine overhauling facility supported by professionally trained Specialised Engineers and excellent marketing and customer care team.
Varman Aviation Pvt. Ltd. has been overhauling Lycoming as well as Continental Engines for various customers like Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Uran Academy (IGRUA), Madhya Pradesh Flying Club (MPFC), Rajiv Gandhi Aviation Academy (RGAA), National Flying Training Institute (NFTI), Nagpur, etc. More than 150 Engines have been overhauled including Engines from Jordan and Nepal, etc., as on date.
During the year 2007 – 08 Varman Aviation Pvt. Ltd. under its expansion program built a most modernized infrastructure for overhauling of Pratt & Whitney PT6A series of Turbo-Prop Engines, which powers Beach King Air C 90, and B200 and Twin Otter Aircrafts.

Pegasus Innovation Lab, with a presence in Silicon Valley, was established by Pegasus Airlines in 2023 to take our "Digital Airline" promise to the next level by breaking the mold of "traditional" practices and drive innovation using cutting-edge technologies. 
We are Pegasus Airlines. We take strength and energy from our innovative, inquisitive, and entrepreneurial approach since the launch of our low-cost business model in 2005. Further guided by our “Digital Airline” proposition to our passengers and our workforce, we are taking progressive steps on technology and innovation since 2018. Our journey focuses on innovation, efficiency, and customer-centric solutions. We are determined to invest in the right people and tools to take us forward. All of this has helped us realize significant digital transformation projects, first of its kind in our home country and across the global aviation industry and brought us in the forefront of technology in aviation, while delivering a growing network connectivity to more passengers, with industry-leading unit cost base and operational profitability.    
 
Pegasus Innovation Lab is dedicated to driving value at every stage of our journey. Leading technological advancement, we are committed to scouting, adopting, and implementing cutting-edge technologies. By doing so, we ensure that Pegasus Airlines is a leading low-cost airline across the industry, continuously pushing the boundaries and setting new standards of excellence.
 
Pegasus Innovation Lab combines a vibrant ecosystem of startups, talented individuals, technology companies, other airlines, and universities. By leveraging this diverse network, we aim to drive innovation and creativity, ensuring that we stay at the heart of technological progress.
 
We are developing innovative tech solutions at Pegasus Airlines to keep ahead of the curve, crafting a seamless travel experience so impressive that it leaves passengers saying, 'That’s brilliant!'

Job Title: Aircraft Maintenance Technician- Now working as a C130H crew chief (supervisor)
Custom company location: King Abdulaziz International Airport Building, Jeddah, Makkah Region 23434, Saudi Arabia
Custom company description:
Saudia Aerospace Engineering Industries (SAEI) is a world class full-service Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) organization, the leading MRO in Saudi Arabia and is one of the largest and most experienced MRO in the MENA. SAEI is wholly-owned by Saudi Arabian Airlines Holding. SAEI’s head quarter and main base is located at King Abdul Aziz International Airport (KAIA) in Jeddah in Saudi Arabia.
SAEI’s main base facility in Jeddah accommodates wide body aircraft up to B747-400 and B777, with future planned expansion of maintenance hangars capable of accommodating A380 Aircraft.
SAEI has been the right technical arm of Saudia that provides its full maintenance support to Saudia fleet. SAEI is also providing its services to Saudia’s affiliates and to several other major local, regional and international airlines.
SAEI today is backed by over 59 years of experience and more than 4,500 highly qualified and trained professional workforce, 90% of which are Saudi nationals. SAEI offers an extensive array of integrated maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) services to civil and military aircraft owners and operators, both locally and abroad.
SAEI is an ISO 9001:2000 certified organization. It is renowned for its quality services and safety standards. SAEI holds several aviation authorities’ approvals including GACA, FAA, EASA, CAACI & IOSA to provide airframe, line, engine, and component maintenance services.
SAEI currently has the capability for repair and overhaul a large portion of aircraft components including aircraft engines and Auxiliary Power Units (APU’s). SAEI facilities are equipped with ATEC 6000 test computers and have a standalone engine shop that handles various types of aircraft engines and APU’s.
Simply … the right choice …
For more info visit our website

Air Charter Service arranges aircraft charters for organisations including governments, large multinational corporations, royalty and international aid agencies. The company specialises in providing tailor made charter solutions for any aircraft charter request ranging from transportation of football fans to international matches to transporting outsized pieces of cargo and VIP trips. 
ACS continues to grow and now generates revenues of over $1 billion, arranging over 30,000 flights per year.

Custom company location: 999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Montreal, Quebec h3c 5h7, Canada
Custom company description:
The Regional Aviation Safety Group – Pan America (RASG-PA) was established in November 2008 to use the framework provided by the ICAO Global Aviation Safety Plan (GASP) and the Global Aviation Safety Roadmap (GASR) to support the establishment and operation of a performance based aviation safety system in the Pan American Region.
RASG-PA serves as regional cooperative for integrating global, regional, national, and industry efforts in continuing to enhance aviation safety in the Region. RASG-PA eliminates duplication of effort through the establishment of cooperative regional safety initiatives and activities. This coordinated approach significantly reduces both financial and human resource burdens on States and allows for the delivery of measurable safety improvements.
Vision
 
The RASG-PA vision is to remain ahead of any risks to commercial aviation, and to collaborate towards achieving the highest level of safety in the Pan American Region.
 
Mission
 
The RASG-PA mission is to reduce fatality risk in commercial aviation by ensuring prioritization, coordination and implementation of data-driven safety enhancement initiatives in the Pan American Region through the active involvement of all civil aviation stakeholders.
If you want to know all our members, you can consult the following link: https://www.icao.int/RASGPA/Pages/Members.aspx

Custom company location: 5020 Hangar Rd, Blagnac, Occitania 20171, France
Custom company description:
Airbus Space Digital addresses the growing need for Information Superiority by providing Geospatial and Secure Connectivity Solutions. 
We operate the largest constellation of optical and radar Earth observation satellites commercially available today, with unprecedented accuracy. Derived from our unrivalled data, we produce a comprehensive portfolio of high-quality elevation models, global reference layers and grids to ensure our customers and partners receive information that perfectly matches their needs across a wide range of markets.
We’re also recognised as a world leader in satellite communications and ground infrastructure networks, supplying governments, militaries and international agencies with mission-critical voice and high-speed data communications across land, sea and air.
Follow us for our latest news and insights!

Custom company location: King Abdulaziz International Airport Building, Jeddah, Makkah Region 23434, Saudi Arabia
Custom company description:
Saudia Aerospace Engineering Industries (SAEI) is a world class full-service Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) organization, the leading MRO in Saudi Arabia and is one of the largest and most experienced MRO in the MENA. SAEI is wholly-owned by Saudi Arabian Airlines Holding. SAEI’s head quarter and main base is located at King Abdul Aziz International Airport (KAIA) in Jeddah in Saudi Arabia.
SAEI’s main base facility in Jeddah accommodates wide body aircraft up to B747-400 and B777, with future planned expansion of maintenance hangars capable of accommodating A380 Aircraft.
SAEI has been the right technical arm of Saudia that provides its full maintenance support to Saudia fleet. SAEI is also providing its services to Saudia’s affiliates and to several other major local, regional and international airlines.
SAEI today is backed by over 59 years of experience and more than 4,500 highly qualified and trained professional workforce, 90% of which are Saudi nationals. SAEI offers an extensive array of integrated maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) services to civil and military aircraft owners and operators, both locally and abroad.
SAEI is an ISO 9001:2000 certified organization. It is renowned for its quality services and safety standards. SAEI holds several aviation authorities’ approvals including GACA, FAA, EASA, CAACI & IOSA to provide airframe, line, engine, and component maintenance services.
SAEI currently has the capability for repair and overhaul a large portion of aircraft components including aircraft engines and Auxiliary Power Units (APU’s). SAEI facilities are equipped with ATEC 6000 test computers and have a standalone engine shop that handles various types of aircraft engines and APU’s.
Simply … the right choice …
For more info visit our website

Custom company location: New Delhi 414 Nehru Place, 110019, India
Custom company description:
Blueheights Aviation Pvt. Ltd. is India’s leading name in premium aviation services, offering seamless Char Dham Yatra by helicopter (5N/6D), exclusive private jet charters, and charter helicopter rentals across the country.
Based in New Delhi, we specialize in organizing luxurious spiritual tours, especially our top-rated Char Dham Yatra by Helicopter ex-Dehradun. This all-inclusive package covers Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath with VIP darshan, 5-star accommodations, guided visits, and all meals — crafted for comfort, safety, and divine experience.
We also cater to elite business and leisure travelers through private jet bookings, providing aircraft ranging from light jets to heavy jets and long-range international charters. With personalized flight plans, on-demand departures, and luxury interiors, our jets redefine business and personal travel.
For faster regional connectivity or special occasions, our helicopter charter services are perfect for airport transfers, weddings, political rallies, medical emergencies, and aerial surveys.
At Blueheights, safety, transparency, and luxury form the core of our operations. Our commitment to operational excellence, DGCA-compliant aircraft, and customer-first service make us the preferred choice for high-net-worth individuals, corporates, and spiritual seekers alike.
Experience aviation with a purpose — luxury that elevates.

Email: sales@blueheightaviation.com
Visit: www.blueheightaviation.com

Custom company location: Airport Road, Abu Dhabi Emirate, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
The General Civil Aviation Authority (GCAA) was created in 1996 by Federal Cabinet Decree (Law 4) to regulate Civil Aviation and provide designated aviation services with emphasis on safety and security and to strengthen the aviation industry within the UAE and its upper airspace. The main office is located in Abu Dhabi and the regional office is located in Dubai to serve the northern Emirates.

The GCAA, which is the sole authority for the control and regulation of civil aviation in the UAE, is responsible for the provision of en-route air navigation services and all aspects of flight safety. In late 2009, the GCAA opened its new Air Navigation Centre, The Sheikh Zayed Centre, which is considered the largest and busiest air traffic management facility in the Middle East as well as one of the world’s most technically advanced centres in terms of its design.  

The United Arab Emirates, represented by GCAA, is an active member of the Council of the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) and its specialized committees. It is also a member of the Arab Civil Aviation Commission (ACAC) Executive Council, and currently H.E Saif Mohammed Al Suwaidi, Director General of GCAA.

Pursuant to the Concession Agreement between GLS and the Government of Liberia; ratified into Law by the House of Legislature on July 11, 2017, and further assignment to GLS-NAS Inc., GLS-NAS is the exclusive service provider of cargo warehousing, freighter handling services and ramp handling of cargo. 
Under the terms of the agreement, GLS - NAS will design, finance, build, maintain, operate and transfer (DFBMOT) a new, modern cargo facility at the Roberts International Airport (RIA) in Monrovia. This new facility will improve RIA’s air cargo operations to meet international standards and support export supply chain capacity in the country. 
 
The new storage facility will cover a ground area of approximately 2,700 sqm.  Other equipment improvements, including upgrades to current operating systems and capacity as well as certifications and capabilities to handle all forms of cargo under the International Air Transport Association (IATA) scope, will be also be made. 
Once completed in 2019, the facility will also be equipped to handle special cargo, such as perishables, pharmaceuticals, minerals, vulnerable goods, dangerous goods and hazardous materials. The facility will also have a dedicated freighter parking to support time efficient operations.

Job Title: Director Aircraft Components Maintenance - Material Management

Custom company description:
Saudia Aerospace Engineering Industries (SAEI) is a world class full-service Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) organization, the leading MRO in Saudi Arabia and is one of the largest and most experienced MRO in the MENA. SAEI is wholly-owned by Saudi Arabian Airlines Holding. SAEI’s head quarter and main base is located at King Abdul Aziz International Airport (KAIA) in Jeddah in Saudi Arabia.
SAEI’s main base facility in Jeddah accommodates wide body aircraft up to B747-400 and B777, with future planned expansion of maintenance hangars capable of accommodating A380 Aircraft.
SAEI has been the right technical arm of Saudia that provides its full maintenance support to Saudia fleet. SAEI is also providing its services to Saudia’s affiliates and to several other major local, regional and international airlines.
SAEI today is backed by over 59 years of experience and more than 4,500 highly qualified and trained professional workforce, 90% of which are Saudi nationals. SAEI offers an extensive array of integrated maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) services to civil and military aircraft owners and operators, both locally and abroad.
SAEI is an ISO 9001:2000 certified organization. It is renowned for its quality services and safety standards. SAEI holds several aviation authorities’ approvals including GACA, FAA, EASA, CAACI & IOSA to provide airframe, line, engine, and component maintenance services.
SAEI currently has the capability for repair and overhaul a large portion of aircraft components including aircraft engines and Auxiliary Power Units (APU’s). SAEI facilities are equipped with ATEC 6000 test computers and have a standalone engine shop that handles various types of aircraft engines and APU’s.

Job Title: Chairman Regional Aviation Safety Group Middle East
Former Position: Executive Vice President Of Safety & Aviation Standards
Custom company location: 999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Montreal, Quebec h3c 5h7, Canada
Custom company description:
The Regional Aviation Safety Group – Pan America (RASG-PA) was established in November 2008 to use the framework provided by the ICAO Global Aviation Safety Plan (GASP) and the Global Aviation Safety Roadmap (GASR) to support the establishment and operation of a performance based aviation safety system in the Pan American Region.
RASG-PA serves as regional cooperative for integrating global, regional, national, and industry efforts in continuing to enhance aviation safety in the Region. RASG-PA eliminates duplication of effort through the establishment of cooperative regional safety initiatives and activities. This coordinated approach significantly reduces both financial and human resource burdens on States and allows for the delivery of measurable safety improvements.
Vision
 
The RASG-PA vision is to remain ahead of any risks to commercial aviation, and to collaborate towards achieving the highest level of safety in the Pan American Region.
 
Mission
 
The RASG-PA mission is to reduce fatality risk in commercial aviation by ensuring prioritization, coordination and implementation of data-driven safety enhancement initiatives in the Pan American Region through the active involvement of all civil aviation stakeholders.
If you want to know all our members, you can consult the following link: https://www.icao.int/RASGPA/Pages/Members.aspx

Custom company description:
Alpha Aviation Group (AAG) is a leading provider of aviation training solutions, working with airlines across the globe, and offering a wide range of services. It specializes in cadet assessment and selection, type ratings and flagship ab-initio cadet programs. All these are tailored and optimized to the operational needs of its partner airlines.
The domestic and South East Asian markets are served from AAG’s base in the Philippines where they operate an Approved Training Organization (ATO) and a certified Type Rating Training Organization (TRTO) for the Airbus A320.
It also has the only EASA-certified Level D Airbus A320 Full Flight Simulator in its Philippine platform.
The Middle East Region is served by Alpha Aviation Academy UAE, a joint venture with Air Arabia in Sharjah UAE, the biggest MPL provider in the Region.
Alpha Aviation Group is a pioneering institution in pushing for the Multi-crew Pilot License (MPL) in the Philippines and UAE, the latter being the largest provider of First Officers via the MPL route. AAG has a proven track record of entering new markets and developing local relationships with regulators and airlines – often having to cross-certify between countries.
In June 2017, AAG formed a strong partnership with Philippine Airlines which involves leasing the company’s first ever CAE A330/340 Full Flight Simulator in the Philippines.

Custom company location: Al Sharqi Rd International Airport, Fujairah Emirate, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
Fujairah Aviation Academy formerly known as Fujairah Aviation Centre was originally founded in 1986 under the patronage of His Highness Sheikh Saleh Mohammed Hamad Al Sharqi. As one of the school’s first students and still a keen pilot himself, Sheik Saleh continues to promote and support interest and knowledge of the Aviation Industry to aspiring pilots.

Over the first twenty years Fujairah Aviation Academy has provided professional aviation education for students requiring the Private Pilots License and the Commercial Pilots License. With the emergence of the United Arab Emirates as a world class business centre bringing innovation, expertise and technology to the region, we enter into our third decade being proud to introduce an Academy of Aviation Excellence in the form of the first dedicated Airline Transport Pilots License School in the Middle East.

All of the Fujairah Aviation Academy’s courses are approved by the UAE GCAA, and upon successful completion, result in the issue of a UAE licence. The UAE is a member of International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO). Licences issued by the UAE are convertible to the licences of other ICAO states, subject to their civil aviation regulations.

Why Fujairah for Flight Training?

The Fujairah International Airport is ideally located for flight training. Following are some of its advantages:

• No waiting for taxi clearance, no holding or orbiting.
• Un-restricted takeoffs and landings.
• Training area is located only five minutes flight time after take off.
• Open seven days a week.
• Excellent weather throughout the year.
• Airfield is equipped with NDB/VOR/DME/ILS and Radar navigation facilities.
• Air Traffic Control, Met and Flight Briefing available 24 hours.
• Quiet environment is conducive to learning.
• Accommodation and food are inexpensive.

The first aviation company in Saudi Arabia and second in the Middle East, Mukamalah Aviation Company Limited (Mukamalah) was established in 1934 under the name of Saudi Aramco Aviation with the core mission of oil exploration through the vast Saudi desert. From its headquarters in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, Mukamalah operates more than 60 aircraft from different fleets all serving different purposes but with the common goal of helping in the business’ success.  In addition to its massive fleet, Mukamalah regularly serves 18 airports throughout Saudi Arabia, nine of which Mukamalah fully manages, serves, and operates, and more than 300 helipads, both on and offshore.
We provide charted business flights to corporate clients and all interested organizations. We have a diverse fleet of nearly fifty jets that serve different purposes and cover geographical areas impossible to reach by land. Additionally, we manage nine, and operate from eighteen, airports across the Kingdom, and reach more than 300 helipads. In 2023, Mukamalah’s pilots logged 51,437 flying hours with an average 97% on-time takeoff rate. 
Mukamalah proudly provides passenger and cargo transport, medical evacuation, geological surveying, and search and rescue missions, maintenance, repair and operations just to name a few. Mukamalah has been able to carry out all of these services since 1934, with an exceptional safety and reliability record, which would not have been achieved without achieving globally recognized safety standards.

Over the first twenty years Fujairah Aviation Academy has provided professional aviation education for students requiring the Private Pilots License and the Commercial Pilots License. With the emergence of the United Arab Emirates as a world class business centre bringing innovation, expertise and technology to the region, we enter into our third decade being proud to introduce an Academy of Aviation Excellence in the form of the first dedicated Airline Transport Pilots License School in the Middle East.

All of the Fujairah Aviation Academy’s courses are approved by the UAE GCAA, and upon successful completion, result in the issue of a UAE licence. The UAE is a member of International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO). Licences issued by the UAE are convertible to the licences of other ICAO states, subject to their civil aviation regulations.

Why Fujairah for Flight Training?

The Fujairah International Airport is ideally located for flight training. Following are some of its advantages:

• No waiting for taxi clearance, no holding or orbiting.
• Un-restricted takeoffs and landings.
• Training area is located only five minutes flight time after take off.
• Open seven days a week.
• Excellent weather throughout the year.
• Airfield is equipped with NDB/VOR/DME/ILS and Radar navigation facilities.
• Air Traffic Control, Met and Flight Briefing available 24 hours.
• Quiet environment is conducive to learning.
• Accommodation and food are inexpensive.

Contact HQ Address 1: Airways Company Building Al Dajeej Area Safat Jileeb
Custom company location: Airways Company Building Al Dajeej Area Safat Jileeb, Al-Shiyukh, Farwaniya, Kuwait
Custom company description:
Kuwait Airways (KU: IATA, KAC: ICAO) is the official national carrier of the State of Kuwait.
 
On the wave of the oil boom of the 1940s, a national carrier was born in 1954. Initially, Kuwait Airways Company served a limited network of Basra, Abadan, Beirut, Damascus and Jerusalem; however, a year later the fledgling carrier was facing economic hardship, and the government of Kuwait took a 50% interest in the airline, subsequently doubling the company's capital. Having entered the rough and tumble world of aviation, the government finally took 100% share in Kuwait Airways.
 
Kuwait Airways entered the jet age in 1962 by leasing a Comet 4-C, the world's first jet-engined airliner. In the 1960s, the national carrier rapidly expanded its route map, and scheduled services to London began three times a week. To keep pace with fast-moving aviation requirements, three Boeing 707s were delivered in 1968. Ten years later, Kuwait Airways had an all Boeing 707 fleet of eight aircraft. 
 
In 1978, Kuwait Airways entered the wide-body age by taking delivery of its first two B747-200s, adding a third the following year. This expansion permitted Kuwait Airways to extend its network to New York to the west and Manila to the east. 
Modernization of the fleet continued, and four B727-200s were delivered in 1980-1981. Two years later, eight Airbus A310s and A300-600s were delivered, and in 1986 three Boeing 767-200ER aircraft joined the wide-body fleet.
 
Following the destruction of its premises and 15 of its aircraft during the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait, the airline was relaunched. Moreover, the company was restored after the Liberation of Kuwait, and a basic strategy was constituted to expand its operations around the world. After the Liberation of Kuwait until 1998, the Kuwaiti Airways fleet consisted of 17 aircraft.
 
In 2016, the airline was formally registered as a private company and its Corporate identity was rebranded to reflect its modernization and transformation.

Custom company location: 193 Ham Ti/ba Weg Beim Jäger, Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia 50672, Germany
Custom company description:
With more than 30 subsidiaries and about 25,000 employees worldwide, Lufthansa Technik is the leading manufacturer provider of maintenance, repair, overhaul and modification services for civil aircraft. With tailored maintenance and overhaul programs and state-of-the-art repair methods, Lufthansa Technik ensures the technical reliability and availability of its customers' fleets. Lufthansa Technik is an internationally licensed maintenance, production and development organization. The main divisions of Lufthansa Technik (Maintenance, Overhaul, Component Services, Engine Services, VIP & Executive Jet Solutions and Landing Gear Services) serve more than 750 customers worldwide.
The complete spectrum of MRO activities is carried out in Lufthansa Technik’s global network of facilities, from small overnight checks on regional aircraft to a complete overhaul of large commercial jetliner. Lufthansa Technik also offers integrated high-tech products, for example cabin equipment, entertainment and communication systems, as well as technical support for flying operations, like AOG (aircraft-on-ground) services, financial services, logistics support, consulting and training courses which can be delivered all over the world.
With our podcast KEEP YOU FLYING, we'd like to give you an insight into the fascinating world of aircraft maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO). Here, our colleagues share their unique insights and knowledge and talk about their personal field of competence or projects. If you want to hear about the current trends and repair methods, new predictive maintenance approaches, or the latest technologies in outfitting the latest-generation VIP aircraft, follow us!

Custom company description:
The Regional Aviation Safety Group – Pan America (RASG-PA) was established in November 2008 to use the framework provided by the ICAO Global Aviation Safety Plan (GASP) and the Global Aviation Safety Roadmap (GASR) to support the establishment and operation of a performance based aviation safety system in the Pan American Region.
RASG-PA serves as regional cooperative for integrating global, regional, national, and industry efforts in continuing to enhance aviation safety in the Region. RASG-PA eliminates duplication of effort through the establishment of cooperative regional safety initiatives and activities. This coordinated approach significantly reduces both financial and human resource burdens on States and allows for the delivery of measurable safety improvements.
Vision
 
The RASG-PA vision is to remain ahead of any risks to commercial aviation, and to collaborate towards achieving the highest level of safety in the Pan American Region.
 
Mission
 
The RASG-PA mission is to reduce fatality risk in commercial aviation by ensuring prioritization, coordination and implementation of data-driven safety enhancement initiatives in the Pan American Region through the active involvement of all civil aviation stakeholders.
If you want to know all our members, you can consult the following link: https://www.icao.int/RASGPA/Pages/Members.aspx

Custom company description:
In the early 1980’s, Kuwait airways identified the need for a separate company to undertake many of its ground handling functions. In addition, the provision of a flight kitchen operating to first class international standards at Kuwait International Airport was seen as essential for the future growth of the airport. Kuwait Airways therefore established in 1981 a wholly owned subsidiary Kuwait Aviation Services Company (KASCO) - to meet these needs.
The kitchen established by KASCO was only the first brick that has grown bit by bit into such a huge company designed especially to meet the needs of its customers. Today, after more than thirty year of operation, in addition to its flight kitchen, KASCO is operating Kuwait International Airport’s restaurants and cafeterias, supervising the First Class and Business Class Lounges (Dasman), overseeing V.V.I.P. services, and managing the food and beverage operation of the airport transit hotel.
KASCO started providing catering services to local market under the name of KASCO Gourmet. This project specializes in providing catering services, such as buffets and banquets, as well as meal plans for individuals, private institutions, and some governmental sectors. We also focus on providing V.I.P. and V.V.I.P. privileges and services to our customers.
As another indication of KASCO’s aim to widen its activities, KASCO has established the Hospitals Catering Services in 2003, Our catering service provides reassurance to our clients that meals are of the highest quality and provenance to ensure, the maximum satisfaction of their patients, visitors and staff.

NOVOAIR aspires to reach the highest level of customer’s satisfaction through an uncompromising commitment to safety, reliability, efficiency and stringent adherence to regulatory compliance. We have earned customer’s preference and employee trust through leadership, commitment and service. We invest our profits in people & services to grow. NOVOAIR is committed to uphold On-Time Performance, Superior Services, Safety and Comfort. NOVOAIR, country’s “Best Domestic Airline” adjudged by “Monitor Airline of the Year”, becomes passengers first choice for air travel.

Custom company description:
PT TransNusa Aviation Mandiri (TransNusa) is Indonesia’s fastest-growing airline, recently expanding into international routes. It's distinguished as the first worldwide carrier to operate the COMAC ARJ21 with a custom interior seating only 95 passengers. Similarly, its Airbus 320 features a tailored layout for enhanced passenger comfort and flexibility, accommodating just 174 seats.
In 2023, TransNusa achieved regulatory approval from China for the Jakarta – Guangzhou route, marking a significant milestone. Furthermore, it swiftly secured clearance for the Jakarta – Singapore route, underscoring its agility and strategic positioning. Since October 2022, under new ownership and management, TransNusa has served over 1 million passengers by December 2023.
TransNusa has adopted a unique business model, responding to post-pandemic passenger preferences, and positioning itself as a Premium Service Carrier globally. This approach emphasizes comprehensive services geared towards passenger comfort and flexibility. The airline's inaugural international route from Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, launched on April 14, 2023.
In 2024, TransNusa aims to establish an additional domestic hub and expand its network with more domestic and international routes. Established in 2005, TransNusa ceased operations in 2020 due to the pandemic. However, a change in ownership and management in 2022 revitalized the airline. Since then, TransNusa has rebranded itself as a Premium Service Carrier, committed to providing unparalleled comfort and flexibility to its customers.

Our nominal size range for turned components is Ø12 – Ø1000mm, and for milled components, it is 300 to 6000 mm. We hold CNC machine tolerances of +/- 0.01mm (mill) and +/- 0.005mm (turn). 
Our team has expertise in CATIA V5 R2021, SIEMENS NX, MASTER CAM, VERICUT other process software and systems. We are also ISO 9001:2015 certified and have an IT development team to ensure that we are always utilizing the latest technologies to provide our clients with the best possible service.

Custom company location: Airways Company Building Al Dajeej Area Safat Jileeb, Al-Shiyukh, Farwaniya, Kuwait
Custom company description:
Kuwait Airways (KU: IATA, KAC: ICAO) is the official national carrier of the State of Kuwait.
 
On the wave of the oil boom of the 1940s, a national carrier was born in 1954. Initially, Kuwait Airways Company served a limited network of Basra, Abadan, Beirut, Damascus and Jerusalem; however, a year later the fledgling carrier was facing economic hardship, and the government of Kuwait took a 50% interest in the airline, subsequently doubling the company's capital. Having entered the rough and tumble world of aviation, the government finally took 100% share in Kuwait Airways.
 
Kuwait Airways entered the jet age in 1962 by leasing a Comet 4-C, the world's first jet-engined airliner. In the 1960s, the national carrier rapidly expanded its route map, and scheduled services to London began three times a week. To keep pace with fast-moving aviation requirements, three Boeing 707s were delivered in 1968. Ten years later, Kuwait Airways had an all Boeing 707 fleet of eight aircraft. 
 
In 1978, Kuwait Airways entered the wide-body age by taking delivery of its first two B747-200s, adding a third the following year. This expansion permitted Kuwait Airways to extend its network to New York to the west and Manila to the east. 
Modernization of the fleet continued, and four B727-200s were delivered in 1980-1981. Two years later, eight Airbus A310s and A300-600s were delivered, and in 1986 three Boeing 767-200ER aircraft joined the wide-body fleet.
 
Following the destruction of its premises and 15 of its aircraft during the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait, the airline was relaunched. Moreover, the company was restored after the Liberation of Kuwait, and a basic strategy was constituted to expand its operations around the world. After the Liberation of Kuwait until 1998, the Kuwaiti Airways fleet consisted of 17 aircraft.
 
In 2016, the airline was formally registered as a private company and its Corporate identity was rebranded to reflect its modernization and transformation.

Air Canada est la plus importante société aérienne du Canada, le transporteur national du pays et un membre cofondateur du réseau Star Alliance — le plus vaste regroupement mondial de sociétés aériennes, qui célèbre son 25e anniversaire en 2022. Custom company description:
PT TransNusa Aviation Mandiri (TransNusa) is Indonesia’s fastest-growing airline, recently expanding into international routes. It's distinguished as the first worldwide carrier to operate the COMAC ARJ21 with a custom interior seating only 95 passengers. Similarly, its Airbus 320 features a tailored layout for enhanced passenger comfort and flexibility, accommodating just 174 seats.
In 2023, TransNusa achieved regulatory approval from China for the Jakarta – Guangzhou route, marking a significant milestone. Furthermore, it swiftly secured clearance for the Jakarta – Singapore route, underscoring its agility and strategic positioning. Since October 2022, under new ownership and management, TransNusa has served over 1 million passengers by December 2023.
TransNusa has adopted a unique business model, responding to post-pandemic passenger preferences, and positioning itself as a Premium Service Carrier globally. This approach emphasizes comprehensive services geared towards passenger comfort and flexibility. The airline's inaugural international route from Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, launched on April 14, 2023.
In 2024, TransNusa aims to establish an additional domestic hub and expand its network with more domestic and international routes. Established in 2005, TransNusa ceased operations in 2020 due to the pandemic. However, a change in ownership and management in 2022 revitalized the airline. Since then, TransNusa has rebranded itself as a Premium Service Carrier, committed to providing unparalleled comfort and flexibility to its customers.

Custom company location: Airways Company Building Al Dajeej Area Safat Jileeb, Al-Shiyukh, Farwaniya, Kuwait
Custom company description:
Kuwait Airways (KU: IATA, KAC: ICAO) is the official national carrier of the State of Kuwait.
 
On the wave of the oil boom of the 1940s, a national carrier was born in 1954. Initially, Kuwait Airways Company served a limited network of Basra, Abadan, Beirut, Damascus and Jerusalem; however, a year later the fledgling carrier was facing economic hardship, and the government of Kuwait took a 50% interest in the airline, subsequently doubling the company's capital. Having entered the rough and tumble world of aviation, the government finally took 100% share in Kuwait Airways.
 
Kuwait Airways entered the jet age in 1962 by leasing a Comet 4-C, the world's first jet-engined airliner. In the 1960s, the national carrier rapidly expanded its route map, and scheduled services to London began three times a week. To keep pace with fast-moving aviation requirements, three Boeing 707s were delivered in 1968. Ten years later, Kuwait Airways had an all Boeing 707 fleet of eight aircraft. 
 
In 1978, Kuwait Airways entered the wide-body age by taking delivery of its first two B747-200s, adding a third the following year. This expansion permitted Kuwait Airways to extend its network to New York to the west and Manila to the east. 
Modernization of the fleet continued, and four B727-200s were delivered in 1980-1981. Two years later, eight Airbus A310s and A300-600s were delivered, and in 1986 three Boeing 767-200ER aircraft joined the wide-body fleet.
 
Following the destruction of its premises and 15 of its aircraft during the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait, the airline was relaunched. Moreover, the company was restored after the Liberation of Kuwait, and a basic strategy was constituted to expand its operations around the world. After the Liberation of Kuwait until 1998, the Kuwaiti Airways fleet consisted of 17 aircraft.
 
In 2016, the airline was formally registered as a private company and its Corporate identity was rebranded to reflect its modernization and transformation.

Custom company description:
Depuis 1933, la compagnie Air France porte haut les couleurs de la France à travers le monde entier. Avec une activité, répartie entre le transport aérien de passagers, le fret, la maintenance et l’entretien aéronautique, Air France est un acteur majeur du secteur aérien. Plus de 45 000 collaborateurs se mobilisent au quotidien pour proposer à chaque client, une expérience de voyage unique. Air France, KLM Royal Dutch Airlines et Transavia forment le Groupe Air France-KLM. Le Groupe  s’appuie sur la force de ses hubs de Paris-Charles de Gaulle et d’Amsterdam-Schiphol pour offrir un vaste réseau international. Son programme de fidélité Flying Blue rassemble plus de 17 millions d’adhérents. 
Air France et KLM sont membres de l’alliance SkyTeam qui compte au total, 19 compagnies aériennes.
Air France place la santé et la sécurité de ses clients et de ses personnels au cœur de ses préoccupations. Avec Air France Protect, son engagement sanitaire, la compagnie a instauré les mesures sanitaires les plus strictes pour un voyage en toute sécurité. 
Air France s’est fixé des objectifs ambitieux en matière de développement durable et travaille à réduire et compenser ses émissions de CO2.  Dans le cadre du programme Horizon 2030, la compagnie s’est engagée à réduire de 50% ses émissions de CO2 par passager-kilomètre d’ici à 2030 à travers des investissements importants en faveur du renouvellement de sa flotte par des avions de nouvelle génération, l’utilisation de solutions innovantes pour réduire sa consommation de carburant ou encore l’utilisation progressive de carburants alternatifs durables.

Civil Aviation Authority of Bangladesh (CAAB) functions as the regulatory body for all aviation related activities in Bangladesh. It is also the aeronautical service provider and is responsible for safe, expeditious and efficient flow of air traffic within the Flight Information Region (FIR) bounded by the International geographic boundary of Bangladesh. This organization is the custodian of all airfields and allied facilities including air navigation facilities.
Aviation activities in independent Bangladesh started in the last week of December 1971. Over the years the infrastructure and facilities were developed. At present, aviation activities are being carried out from 3 international and 12 domestic airports, about 38 airlines are now operating in and out of the country; about 43 States signed bilateral agreements with Bangladesh.

Custom company location: King Abdulaziz International Airport Building, Jeddah, Makkah Region 23434, Saudi Arabia
Custom company description:
Saudia Aerospace Engineering Industries (SAEI) is a world class full-service Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) organization, the leading MRO in Saudi Arabia and is one of the largest and most experienced MRO in the MENA. SAEI is wholly-owned by Saudi Arabian Airlines Holding. SAEI’s head quarter and main base is located at King Abdul Aziz International Airport (KAIA) in Jeddah in Saudi Arabia.
SAEI’s main base facility in Jeddah accommodates wide body aircraft up to B747-400 and B777, with future planned expansion of maintenance hangars capable of accommodating A380 Aircraft.
SAEI has been the right technical arm of Saudia that provides its full maintenance support to Saudia fleet. SAEI is also providing its services to Saudia’s affiliates and to several other major local, regional and international airlines.
SAEI today is backed by over 59 years of experience and more than 4,500 highly qualified and trained professional workforce, 90% of which are Saudi nationals. SAEI offers an extensive array of integrated maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) services to civil and military aircraft owners and operators, both locally and abroad.
SAEI is an ISO 9001:2000 certified organization. It is renowned for its quality services and safety standards. SAEI holds several aviation authorities’ approvals including GACA, FAA, EASA, CAACI & IOSA to provide airframe, line, engine, and component maintenance services.
SAEI currently has the capability for repair and overhaul a large portion of aircraft components including aircraft engines and Auxiliary Power Units (APU’s). SAEI facilities are equipped with ATEC 6000 test computers and have a standalone engine shop that handles various types of aircraft engines and APU’s.
Simply … the right choice …
For more info visit our website

Custom company location: 33 Route De L'aéroport, Le Grand-Saconnex, Geneva 1215, Switzerland
Custom company description:
Cargo iQ: Visibly Better
Cargo iQ is an IATA interest group with the mission of creating and implementing quality standards for the worldwide air cargo industry. 
We operate as a not-for-profit membership group supported by IATA and composed of some 80 major airlines, freight forwarders, ground-handling agents, trucking companies and IT solution providers globally.
Cargo iQ members have developed a system of shipment planning and performance monitoring for air cargo based on common business processes and milestones. As part of that system, the Master Operating Plan (MOP) describes the standard end-to-end process of transporting air cargo.

Oman Airports is a state-owned company that manages all the airports of the Sultanate including Muscat International Airport, Duqm Airport, Suhar Airport, Salalah Airport. The Company has also expanded it services to include the management and operation of the PDO regional airports in the oil concession areas of Fahud, Marmul, and Qarn Alam .
Oman Airports is driven by an ultimate aim to improve its position and services in order to meet its aspirations in supporting Oman's national visions by enhancing the airports and improving the overall travel experience.
 Oman Airports provides combined operations, maintenance and infrastructure management, including on-ground services, terminal buildings, cargo buildings, runways, aircraft service, car parking and other facilities, all while maintaining airport certification in compliance with ICAO and CAR 139.

Saudia Aerospace Engineering Industries (SAEI) is a world class full-service Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) organization, the leading MRO in Saudi Arabia and is one of the largest and most experienced MRO in the MENA. SAEI is wholly-owned by Saudi Arabian Airlines Holding. SAEI’s head quarter and main base is located at King Abdul Aziz International Airport (KAIA) in Jeddah in Saudi Arabia.
SAEI’s main base facility in Jeddah accommodates wide body aircraft up to B747-400 and B777, with future planned expansion of maintenance hangars capable of accommodating A380 Aircraft.
SAEI has been the right technical arm of Saudia that provides its full maintenance support to Saudia fleet. SAEI is also providing its services to Saudia’s affiliates and to several other major local, regional and international airlines.
SAEI today is backed by over 59 years of experience and more than 4,500 highly qualified and trained professional workforce, 90% of which are Saudi nationals. SAEI offers an extensive array of integrated maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) services to civil and military aircraft owners and operators, both locally and abroad.
SAEI is an ISO 9001:2000 certified organization. It is renowned for its quality services and safety standards. SAEI holds several aviation authorities’ approvals including GACA, FAA, EASA, CAACI & IOSA to provide airframe, line, engine, and component maintenance services.
SAEI currently has the capability for repair and overhaul a large portion of aircraft components including aircraft engines and Auxiliary Power Units (APU’s). SAEI facilities are equipped with ATEC 6000 test computers and have a standalone engine shop that handles various types of aircraft engines and APU’s.
Simply … the right choice …
For more info visit our website

Custom company description:
At Akasa Air, we believe that the Sky embraces everyone, and so air travel should be inclusive and affordable for all. A robust air transportation system that connects people, cultures, and regions will help our nation soar. This belief motivated us to  a dependable and affordable airline that everybody can relate to. 
We are India’s newest airline, and we launched our first commercial flight on 07 August 2022 to support the growing demand across India with the greenest and youngest fleet in the country.
Warm & efficient customer service, reliable operations, and affordable fares are the cornerstones of our brand promise. This promise is powered by our youthful personality, employee-centric philosophy, a tech-led approach, and a culture of service.
Akasa Air is helmed by a highly professional and experienced leadership team whose sights are set on the Sky while having their ears to the ground. Our team has laid a foundation of an organisation that listens, understands, and anticipates our customers’ needs. What’s more, we are committed to building an airline that’s socially responsible, economically sustainable, and inherently empathetic. 
These are exciting times. We look forward to welcoming you onboard Akasa Air. 
It’s Your Sky!
