Former Position: Lopez Group Business Excellence Program Manager (Quality, Environment, Health and Safety
Contact HQ Address 1: General Aviation Area Building 12 Domestic Airport
Custom company location: General Aviation Area Building 12 Domestic Airport, Pasay, southern manila district 1300, Philippines
Custom company description:
INAEC proudly traces its roots back in 1932 when it started as Iloilo-Negros Air Express Company, the first airline in the Philippines. It was reborn in 1993 initially to serve the aviation needs of the Lopez Group of Companies.
With its strict adherence to international standards and the characteristic Filipino service of warmth and professionalism, the INAEC brand is synonymous with safety, excellence, and integrity.
At present, INAEC is the sole domestic air transport provider for oil and gas producers in the Philippines. INAEC has also become the air charter provider of choice to  clientele of known and established VVIPs, here and abroad.
From domestic and international air charters, INAEC has since expanded its services to include aircraft management, aircraft maintenance, ground-handling and fixed base operations, and aviation training. 
In 2018, INAEC developed its own aviation training arm through the Herminio C. Brion Aviation Training Institute, focusing on aircraft familiarization, type-rating, and other trainings required under the Philippine Civil Aviation Regulations (PCAR).   
In 2019, INAEC obtained its International Standard for Business Aircraft Operations (IS-BA0) Stage 1 Certification. This marked the first time a holder of a Philippine Air Operator Certificate (AOC) has been accorded such distinction. 
In 2021, notwithstanding the challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic, INAEC remained true to its commitment to safety and excellence and achieved its IS-BAO Stage 2 Certification, again remaining the only Philippine AOC holder to do so. INAEC remains the only AOC holder with an IS-BAO Stage 2 Certification in the Philippines.
INAEC brings with it the best of what the Filipino has to offer – the warmth of Filipino hospitality, professionalism, and unstinting devotion to getting things done, and getting things done right.

Custom company description:
Alpha Aviation Group (AAG) is a leading provider of aviation training solutions, working with airlines across the globe, and offering a wide range of services. It specializes in cadet assessment and selection, type ratings and flagship ab-initio cadet programs. All these are tailored and optimized to the operational needs of its partner airlines.
The domestic and South East Asian markets are served from AAG’s base in the Philippines where they operate an Approved Training Organization (ATO) and a certified Type Rating Training Organization (TRTO) for the Airbus A320.
It also has the only EASA-certified Level D Airbus A320 Full Flight Simulator in its Philippine platform.
The Middle East Region is served by Alpha Aviation Academy UAE, a joint venture with Air Arabia in Sharjah UAE, the biggest MPL provider in the Region.
Alpha Aviation Group is a pioneering institution in pushing for the Multi-crew Pilot License (MPL) in the Philippines and UAE, the latter being the largest provider of First Officers via the MPL route. AAG has a proven track record of entering new markets and developing local relationships with regulators and airlines – often having to cross-certify between countries.
In June 2017, AAG formed a strong partnership with Philippine Airlines which involves leasing the company’s first ever CAE A330/340 Full Flight Simulator in the Philippines.

Custom company description: At Alfa Aviation Academy, we believe that becoming a pilot is more than learning to fly—it’s about developing the judgment, professionalism and confidence to lead in the world’s most demanding cockpit environments. As an EASA-certified Approved Training Organization (ATO IT.ATO.0107) with bases in  Italy and Poland, we offer both Integrated and Modular pathways designed for aspiring airline pilots: ATPL Integrated (18–24 months) A full-time, structured program combining ground school and flight training. Ideal if you want the fastest route to an airline transport pilot license without prior experience. Modular Pathway (≈20 months) Study at your own pace: begin with a Private Pilot License, then progress through ATPL theory, instrument rating, and commercial license modules. Perfect for those who need scheduling flexibility. Why Choose Alfa Aviation Academy? EASA-Standard Curriculum Our syllabi strictly follow PART-FCL requirements, ensuring your license is recognized throughout all 31 EASA member states. Experienced Mentors Train under instructors with extensive European aviation backgrounds. They focus on mentorship—supporting you through every milestone and challenge. Pilot Core Competencies Beyond flight hours, we develop the human factors, decision-making and commercial awareness skills airlines value most, in partnership with our industry collaborators. Flexible Financing We assist eligible European students with tailored payment plans and scholarship opportunities, making your dream achievable. Whether you’re drawn to intensive, all-inclusive training or prefer breaking your studies into manageable modules, Alfa Aviation Academy provides the guidance, resources and professional network you need to succeed. Custom company location: New Delhi, India

Custom company description:
SFS Aviation Co., Ltd. is part of a family business group under the ownership of the Ratanarat family. Its founder is one of the few Thais with entrepreneurial and pioneering spirit to venture into many technically-driven businesses generally reserved for foreign companies.
 
Founded in 1990, SFS is the first Thai-owned provider of Offshore Helicopter Service for Oil and Gas Companies in Thailand. SFS is proud that it has remained accident free until today. SFS has a growing fleet of helicopter including the 15 passengers-sized Agustawestland AW139, the fastest and most technologically sophisticated helicopter in Thailand.  We are an AgustaWestland Authorized Service Centre and spare parts dealer for Thailand and Myanmar.
 
SFS is the regional leader in the S.E.Asian region for its robust and effective Integrated Aviation Quality & Safety Management System (‘QSMS’) which work as a self-risk-diagnostic system and safety improvement drivers of all operation and maintenance activities. Couple with strong leadership and modern safety-enhancing technologies, the QSMS is the key process that drives the evolution of process designs towards becoming safer and more reliable processes for implementation. 
 
Safety, service reliability, and customer-responsiveness are the most important qualities that attract customers and support the business growth. SFS strives to assure these qualities through compliance to high standards, promotion of strong and culturally-adaptable leadership to drive the company under its primary philosophy:-

“Preservation of Life by creation of Safety Culture, lifting human spirit, utilizing safety technologies, and systematically manage safety with process-design-creativity.”

Custom company location: 999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Montreal, Quebec h3c 5h7, Canada
Custom company description:
The Regional Aviation Safety Group – Pan America (RASG-PA) was established in November 2008 to use the framework provided by the ICAO Global Aviation Safety Plan (GASP) and the Global Aviation Safety Roadmap (GASR) to support the establishment and operation of a performance based aviation safety system in the Pan American Region.
RASG-PA serves as regional cooperative for integrating global, regional, national, and industry efforts in continuing to enhance aviation safety in the Region. RASG-PA eliminates duplication of effort through the establishment of cooperative regional safety initiatives and activities. This coordinated approach significantly reduces both financial and human resource burdens on States and allows for the delivery of measurable safety improvements.
Vision
 
The RASG-PA vision is to remain ahead of any risks to commercial aviation, and to collaborate towards achieving the highest level of safety in the Pan American Region.
 
Mission
 
The RASG-PA mission is to reduce fatality risk in commercial aviation by ensuring prioritization, coordination and implementation of data-driven safety enhancement initiatives in the Pan American Region through the active involvement of all civil aviation stakeholders.
If you want to know all our members, you can consult the following link: https://www.icao.int/RASGPA/Pages/Members.aspx

Why HPS Aviation?
25% more efficient than traditional propulsion systems.
Compact, scalable design for drones to large flying platforms.
Hydrogen + electric hybrid for zero-emission urban air mobility.

Custom company location: 230 Airport Road, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
DAEP (Dubai Aviation Engineering Projects) is a leading engineering organisation responsible for the design, master planning, infrastructure development and construction of Dubai’s dynamic aviation sector. On behalf of the Government of Dubai, we spearhead the development of the world’s second-busiest airport for international passenger traffic, Dubai International Airport, and the emirate’s new airport, Al Maktoum International Airport, part of the world’s first 140-square-kilometer purpose-built aerotropolis, Dubai World Central.

Our engineering ingenuity is based on years of overcoming technical, logistics, timing, and resource challenges on some of the world’s most complex and sophisticated engineering projects. Whether it is master planning a mega aviation district or poring over the smallest technical details, we never lose sight of our ultimate objective – to deliver state-of-the-art engineering projects that empower economies, facilitate trade and bring people together.

DAEP works closely with its stakeholders to enable the continued excellence and strategic growth of Dubai’s aviation sector. This requires an intimate understanding of the plans, projections and objectives of the different entities driving the dynamic aviation sector and working seamlessly together to bridge today’s capacity needs with tomorrow’s possibilities.

Custom company location: Al Sharqi Rd International Airport, Fujairah Emirate, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
Fujairah Aviation Academy formerly known as Fujairah Aviation Centre was originally founded in 1986 under the patronage of His Highness Sheikh Saleh Mohammed Hamad Al Sharqi. As one of the school’s first students and still a keen pilot himself, Sheik Saleh continues to promote and support interest and knowledge of the Aviation Industry to aspiring pilots.

Over the first twenty years Fujairah Aviation Academy has provided professional aviation education for students requiring the Private Pilots License and the Commercial Pilots License. With the emergence of the United Arab Emirates as a world class business centre bringing innovation, expertise and technology to the region, we enter into our third decade being proud to introduce an Academy of Aviation Excellence in the form of the first dedicated Airline Transport Pilots License School in the Middle East.

All of the Fujairah Aviation Academy’s courses are approved by the UAE GCAA, and upon successful completion, result in the issue of a UAE licence. The UAE is a member of International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO). Licences issued by the UAE are convertible to the licences of other ICAO states, subject to their civil aviation regulations.

Why Fujairah for Flight Training?

The Fujairah International Airport is ideally located for flight training. Following are some of its advantages:

• No waiting for taxi clearance, no holding or orbiting.
• Un-restricted takeoffs and landings.
• Training area is located only five minutes flight time after take off.
• Open seven days a week.
• Excellent weather throughout the year.
• Airfield is equipped with NDB/VOR/DME/ILS and Radar navigation facilities.
• Air Traffic Control, Met and Flight Briefing available 24 hours.
• Quiet environment is conducive to learning.
• Accommodation and food are inexpensive.

Custom company description:
Top aviation, established in the year 2003, founded to provide its customers with a full range of solutions for ground handling.
Its scope of services includes representations before the Civil Aviation Authority, obtaining the necessary traffic rights and negotiating airport slots, arranging for and supervising ramp handling, performing computerized passenger handling including load control, crew transportation and sightseeing tours, baggage tracing using World tracer System, providing discounts on fuel and catering, preparing meteorological documentation and aeronautical information, arranging V.I.P immigration assistance including the V.I.P lounge, assist and negotiate handling contracts and measuring quality and relevant costs for handling.
Top Aviation’s strategy is built around offering highly personalized service to its clientele. Integral to this approach is the careful selection of staff, through training in promptly adapting to clients’ requests, and in-depth support for more difficult requests. The ever-growing competitiveness of the aviation industry is quickly resulting in an increasing need to satisfy customers’ demands for top quality. Top Aviation’s employees are steadfastly committed to providing the expected level of excellence with responsive services at a competitive price. It goes without saying that safety is of the greatest importance, therefore Top Aviation strives for nothing less than the most stringent safety standards of the Aviation Industry.
Top Aviation has been formed to allow partakers in today’s competitive environment to fulfill their need to be cost-conscious and service-oriented, professionally and successfully. Top Aviation seeks to provide its clients with perfect performance, a reliable partner, efficient cost control, transparency and trust while saving the clients’ valuable time for more important tasks.
Its customer-focused approach and commitment, guarantees that Top Aviation will retain a highly satisfied clientele

Custom company location: 8 Shenton Way, 068811, Singapore
Custom company description:
BOC Aviation is a top tier global aircraft operating leasing company with industry leading financial metrics.
Our core business model is focused on purchasing new, fuel-efficient, in-demand aircraft at competitive prices directly from aircraft manufacturers, financing those aircraft purchases efficiently, placing our aircraft on long-term operating leases with a globally diversified customer base and selling our aircraft to maintain a young fleet, to mitigate risks in our aircraft portfolio and to generate gains on sale, as well as reinvesting the sale proceeds in new aircraft investments. We provide comprehensive aircraft remarketing and technical management services to airlines, banks and other investors and have introduced finance leases for aircraft and engines. 
Our portfolio of owned aircraft has an average age of less than five years, weighted by net book value, making it one of the youngest in the aircraft operating lease industry. We have long-term contracted cash flows, with a weighted average remaining lease term on the owned portfolio of around eight years.
 
We benefit from a low average cost of funds, supported by our strong credit ratings (A- from both Standard & Poor’s and Fitch) and a diversified range of funding sources. We also enjoy strong and committed support from our controlling shareholder, Bank of China.
BOC Aviation is listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEx code: 2588) and has its headquarters in Singapore with offices in Dublin, London, New York and Tianjin.

Custom company description:
Abu Dhabi Aviation (ADA) stands out as a global leader in aviation, truly a UAE Champion on a World stage. ADA offers a comprehensive range of services for both military and civilian sectors, specialising in rotary and fixed-wing aircraft. The company’s expertise extends to maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) services, air cargo solutions, luxury travel, helicopter leasing, advanced aircraft simulator training, and technical training.
Abu Dhabi Aviation provides aviation services to a range of sectors, including offshore oil support, aerial construction, medical evacuation, and search and rescue. The company also offers MRO services for helicopters, delivering comprehensive maintenance, repair, and overhaul services for various helicopter models to ensure their optimal performance and safety. In addition, Abu Dhabi Aviation provides maintenance and overhaul services for fixed-wing aircraft, including narrow and wide-body jets and turboprops, catering to the needs of both civil and military aviation. The company also specialises in maintenance services for aircraft engines and components, ensuring reliability and extending the lifespan of aviation assets.
The company is certified by major OEMs such as Leonardo, Honeywell, Bell, Boeing, and Airbus, and holds approvals from leading regulatory bodies, including the GCAA, FAA, and EASA. With a dedicated workforce of 9,500, Abu Dhabi Aviation continues to set benchmarks in the aviation and related sectors.
ADA is part of the Abu Dhabi Aviation Group of companies along with AMMROC, GAL, ADATC, Maximus, Royal Jet, AWAS, Adaire & Etihad Engineering.

Zenith is a global Aviation Consulting firm focused on providing solutions to aviation businesses and related services industries. The Zenith differentiator over competitors is that our team have worked at all levels in organisations bringing together a practical hands on approach which is then layered with management and director level exposure. SEALTECH was founded in 1991 in Hong Kong specialized in supplying Seals and O-rings originally manufactured from Europe and America. Our mission and objectives are customer satisfaction and quality priority. We aim to be the top-class seals specialist in the region and the best and large selection of O-rings in the market. Apart from this, we also have our own CNC machines and material exported from Austria which allow us to manufacture seals of different sizes and no MOQ as well.
In March 2016, Sealtech.com Aviation Seals Mfg. Ltd (SCAS) successfully obtained the Parts Manufacturing Approval (HPMA), where our products can be installed on the aircraft registered in China, Hong Kong, and Macau, issued by the Hong Kong Civil Aviation Department (HKCAD) and became the first Hong Kong manufacturer that can be able to enter the aviation supply chain. In June 2017, SCAS obtained the Aviation Industry Quality Management System Certification included AS9100, AS9120 and ISO9001. This means that the management system, product design, production process, and quality assurance of SCAS have reached the international aviation industry level. In order to provide more and better choices for the aviation industry in the Greater China region, SCAS is committed to develop and produce high-value performance HPMA parts. Regarding future developments, SCAS is setting up an ISO/IEC17025 laboratory to facilitate product development and quality testing and we are applying for NADCAP to enter the OEM market.

Custom company location: Domestic Rd Domestic Road, Pasay, southern manila district 1301, Philippines
Custom company description:
Aviation Partnership (Philippines) Corporation or Aplus, a Cebu Pacific subsidiary, was originally born to provide a solution and satisfy a need in an airline's operations but it eventually grew to the profitable and sought-after business venture that it is today. 
Our journey began when low-cost carrier Cebu Pacific had the direction to focus on its core activities and decided to outsource its maintenance and engineering support requirements.
In April 2005, Singapore Airlines Engineering Company and Cebu Pacific Air signed a joint venture agreement which gave birth to Aplus whose main business was to provide line and light maintenance services. In July of the same year, Aplus officially commenced its operations. 
In November 2020 however, together with the appointment of a mostly new core management team in the company, Cebu Pacific decided to take sole ownership of Aplus. 
The company has been thriving since as the new management navigated itself through the pandemic and is now poised to take off to reach even greater heights with the full backing of its sole parent.

Elevate Your Aviation Operations with Expert ERP Solutions:
As a leading consultancy for the aviation sector, we specialize in helping CAMO (Continuing Airworthiness Management Organisation), MRO (Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul) providers and airline companies , implement, and optimize ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems. Our goal is to streamline operations, enhance regulatory compliance, and boost efficiency at every level of your aviation business.
We offer end-to-end ERP solutions tailored to the unique needs of aviation operators and MRO organizations. Our services include:
•ERP System Selection : We guide you in choosing the right ERP solution based on your specific business needs, helping you make an informed decision.
•End-to-End Implementation : From planning and system installation to training and post-implementation support, we ensure a smooth and successful ERP deployment.
•Customization & Integration : We adapt ERP systems to fit your existing processes, integrating seamlessly with your current technology stack for maximum efficiency.

Custom company description:
SAPPHIRE INTERNATIONAL AVIATION ACADEMY was established to cater to the growing worldwide demand for aircraft pilots. With its high literacy rate and proficiency in the English language, the Philippines is now virtually the pilot training center of Asia and the far East. Many student pilots from various countries all over the world – India, Indonesia, Nepal, South Korea, United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Egypt, Nigeria – have been coming to the Philippines to enroll in aviation courses.
An estimated 19,000 new, lighter and more fuel-efficient large passenger and cargo aircraft scheduled to be put in service between 2008 and 2020 will  a worldwide demand for at least 460,000 new professional pilots all over the world, particularly, in Asia and its neighboring regions, giving aviation schools their reason for being.
To take advantage of this opportunity, SAPPHIRE AVIATION established its pilot training school with a view to make a difference. This difference – QUALITY – gives SAPPHIRE AVIATION an edge over other flying schools.  Quality in its training programs, quality in its training facilities, quality in its training approach, and quality in its training staff.
To this day, SAPPHIRE AVIATION has already produced a good number of pilots. Some of these are already working with aviation companies.  Others are now working as Flight Instructors and in other aviation-related positions.
SAPPHIRE AVIATION, therefore, is not just another flying school.  It takes its business seriously;  it is here not just for the ride;  it is here to make flying an enjoyable career and a profitable profession.

Custom company location: Al Sharqi Rd International Airport, Fujairah Emirate, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
Fujairah Aviation Academy formerly known as Fujairah Aviation Centre was originally founded in 1986 under the patronage of His Highness Sheikh Saleh Mohammed Hamad Al Sharqi. As one of the school’s first students and still a keen pilot himself, Sheik Saleh continues to promote and support interest and knowledge of the Aviation Industry to aspiring pilots.

Over the first twenty years Fujairah Aviation Academy has provided professional aviation education for students requiring the Private Pilots License and the Commercial Pilots License. With the emergence of the United Arab Emirates as a world class business centre bringing innovation, expertise and technology to the region, we enter into our third decade being proud to introduce an Academy of Aviation Excellence in the form of the first dedicated Airline Transport Pilots License School in the Middle East.

All of the Fujairah Aviation Academy’s courses are approved by the UAE GCAA, and upon successful completion, result in the issue of a UAE licence. The UAE is a member of International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO). Licences issued by the UAE are convertible to the licences of other ICAO states, subject to their civil aviation regulations.

Why Fujairah for Flight Training?

The Fujairah International Airport is ideally located for flight training. Following are some of its advantages:

• No waiting for taxi clearance, no holding or orbiting.
• Un-restricted takeoffs and landings.
• Training area is located only five minutes flight time after take off.
• Open seven days a week.
• Excellent weather throughout the year.
• Airfield is equipped with NDB/VOR/DME/ILS and Radar navigation facilities.
• Air Traffic Control, Met and Flight Briefing available 24 hours.
• Quiet environment is conducive to learning.
• Accommodation and food are inexpensive.

Custom company description:
Alpha Aviation Group (AAG) is a leading provider of aviation training solutions, working with airlines across the globe, and offering a wide range of services. It specializes in cadet assessment and selection, type ratings and flagship ab-initio cadet programs. All these are tailored and optimized to the operational needs of its partner airlines.
The domestic and South East Asian markets are served from AAG’s base in the Philippines where they operate an Approved Training Organization (ATO) and a certified Type Rating Training Organization (TRTO) for the Airbus A320.
It also has the only EASA-certified Level D Airbus A320 Full Flight Simulator in its Philippine platform.
The Middle East Region is served by Alpha Aviation Academy UAE, a joint venture with Air Arabia in Sharjah UAE, the biggest MPL provider in the Region.
Alpha Aviation Group is a pioneering institution in pushing for the Multi-crew Pilot License (MPL) in the Philippines and UAE, the latter being the largest provider of First Officers via the MPL route. AAG has a proven track record of entering new markets and developing local relationships with regulators and airlines – often having to cross-certify between countries.
In June 2017, AAG formed a strong partnership with Philippine Airlines which involves leasing the company’s first ever CAE A330/340 Full Flight Simulator in the Philippines.

Custom company location: Airport Road, Abu Dhabi Emirate, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
The General Civil Aviation Authority (GCAA) was created in 1996 by Federal Cabinet Decree (Law 4) to regulate Civil Aviation and provide designated aviation services with emphasis on safety and security and to strengthen the aviation industry within the UAE and its upper airspace. The main office is located in Abu Dhabi and the regional office is located in Dubai to serve the northern Emirates.

The GCAA, which is the sole authority for the control and regulation of civil aviation in the UAE, is responsible for the provision of en-route air navigation services and all aspects of flight safety. In late 2009, the GCAA opened its new Air Navigation Centre, The Sheikh Zayed Centre, which is considered the largest and busiest air traffic management facility in the Middle East as well as one of the world’s most technically advanced centres in terms of its design.  

The United Arab Emirates, represented by GCAA, is an active member of the Council of the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) and its specialized committees. It is also a member of the Arab Civil Aviation Commission (ACAC) Executive Council, and currently H.E Saif Mohammed Al Suwaidi, Director General of GCAA.

Custom company location: General Aviation Area Building 12 Domestic Airport, Pasay, southern manila district 1300, Philippines
Custom contact location: Quezon City, eastern manila district, Philippines
Custom company description:
INAEC proudly traces its roots back in 1932 when it started as Iloilo-Negros Air Express Company, the first airline in the Philippines. It was reborn in 1993 initially to serve the aviation needs of the Lopez Group of Companies.
With its strict adherence to international standards and the characteristic Filipino service of warmth and professionalism, the INAEC brand is synonymous with safety, excellence, and integrity.
At present, INAEC is the sole domestic air transport provider for oil and gas producers in the Philippines. INAEC has also become the air charter provider of choice to  clientele of known and established VVIPs, here and abroad.
From domestic and international air charters, INAEC has since expanded its services to include aircraft management, aircraft maintenance, ground-handling and fixed base operations, and aviation training. 
In 2018, INAEC developed its own aviation training arm through the Herminio C. Brion Aviation Training Institute, focusing on aircraft familiarization, type-rating, and other trainings required under the Philippine Civil Aviation Regulations (PCAR).   
In 2019, INAEC obtained its International Standard for Business Aircraft Operations (IS-BA0) Stage 1 Certification. This marked the first time a holder of a Philippine Air Operator Certificate (AOC) has been accorded such distinction. 
In 2021, notwithstanding the challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic, INAEC remained true to its commitment to safety and excellence and achieved its IS-BAO Stage 2 Certification, again remaining the only Philippine AOC holder to do so. INAEC remains the only AOC holder with an IS-BAO Stage 2 Certification in the Philippines.
INAEC brings with it the best of what the Filipino has to offer – the warmth of Filipino hospitality, professionalism, and unstinting devotion to getting things done, and getting things done right.

Korea Airports Corporation was established in 1980 to carry out construction, management and operation of airports and to manage air transportation efficiently. As an organization specializing in airport management, KAC manages and operates a total of 14 airports in Korea including Gimpo, Gimhae, Jeju, Daegu, Muan, Cheongju, and Yangyang international airport. KAC also manages the Area Control Center, 10 VORTACs and Korea Civil Aviation Training Center.
Under the Vision 2025 "Connecting the World, Inspiring the Future", as a world class company specializing in airport management that provides impressive customer services and fulfills social responsibilities. Highly committed to value, securing aviation safety and achieving customers satisfaction, KAC will continue to provide service which employees can be proud of, satisfy the public and get the trust of the customers in managerial standards and operational excellence in building public confidence.
KAC is planning to focus on investing in improving the foremost safety and customer service to fulfill the basic duties of KAC. Also, with the know-hows gained from airport management and operation, KAC will strive to work harder to fix its stature as "a globally recognized organization specializing in airport operation and management".
- Mission Statement
To efficiently construct and operate the airports
To Promote airport transportation
To Contribute to the national economic development and the promotion of public well-being

Custom company description:
Headquartered in Shanghai, China Eastern Airlines Corporation Limited (CEA) is among China’s three major airlines. It originated from the first squadron established by former Civil Aviation Administration of Shanghai in January, 1957. After a series of reform, CEA was founded in 1988 and listed on New York, Hong Kong and Shanghai stock markets in 1997, becoming the first airline listed on three markets together.
Currently, it operates a fleet of over 640 aircrafts, with average age less than 5.5 years, being one of the youngest fleets in major airlines in the world. As a member of the SkyTeam Alliance, CEA serves over 100 million passengers globally and ranks 7th in the world. Through its air network, CEA now reaches 1,062 destinations in 177 countries. Frequent Flyers of Eastern Miles are privileged with 672 lounges worldwide within all 20 SkyTeam member airlines.

Custom company description:
Alpha Aviation Group (AAG) is a leading provider of aviation training solutions, working with airlines across the globe, and offering a wide range of services. It specializes in cadet assessment and selection, type ratings and flagship ab-initio cadet programs. All these are tailored and optimized to the operational needs of its partner airlines.
The domestic and South East Asian markets are served from AAG’s base in the Philippines where they operate an Approved Training Organization (ATO) and a certified Type Rating Training Organization (TRTO) for the Airbus A320.
It also has the only EASA-certified Level D Airbus A320 Full Flight Simulator in its Philippine platform.
The Middle East Region is served by Alpha Aviation Academy UAE, a joint venture with Air Arabia in Sharjah UAE, the biggest MPL provider in the Region.
Alpha Aviation Group is a pioneering institution in pushing for the Multi-crew Pilot License (MPL) in the Philippines and UAE, the latter being the largest provider of First Officers via the MPL route. AAG has a proven track record of entering new markets and developing local relationships with regulators and airlines – often having to cross-certify between countries.
In June 2017, AAG formed a strong partnership with Philippine Airlines which involves leasing the company’s first ever CAE A330/340 Full Flight Simulator in the Philippines.

China Business Aviation Group (CBAJET) is a leading aviation services company in Asia, providing comprehensive aviation solutions for customers in Asia and the world. The company was founded in 2010, armed with extensive knowledge and experience gained from mature markets in the West and Asia’s new emerging market. It has quickly become the leading aircraft trading and consulting company in Asia.
CBAJET’s Co-founder, Chairman and CEO, Mr. Jason Liao, is the pioneer and an influential leader of business aviation in Asia. Liao held senior positions with Bombardier, Hawker Beechcraft, and Raytheon Aircraft. He has sold close to 200 business aircraft over the last 20 years. He was one of the founders of the Asian Business Aviation Association (AsBAA) and had served as its chairman or vice-chairman for nearly 10 years. He currently serves the National Business Aviation Association (NBAA) as its chief representative for Asia, actively promoting the development of business aviation in Asia.
CBAJET headquarters in Hong Kong, with offices in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Singapore, and the United States. Its talented stuff have extensive experience in aircraft sales and marketing, aviation project management, aircraft operations and maintenance, interior design and outfitting management, legal, and finance.

Custom company location: Airport Road, Abu Dhabi Emirate, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
The General Civil Aviation Authority (GCAA) was created in 1996 by Federal Cabinet Decree (Law 4) to regulate Civil Aviation and provide designated aviation services with emphasis on safety and security and to strengthen the aviation industry within the UAE and its upper airspace. The main office is located in Abu Dhabi and the regional office is located in Dubai to serve the northern Emirates.

The GCAA, which is the sole authority for the control and regulation of civil aviation in the UAE, is responsible for the provision of en-route air navigation services and all aspects of flight safety. In late 2009, the GCAA opened its new Air Navigation Centre, The Sheikh Zayed Centre, which is considered the largest and busiest air traffic management facility in the Middle East as well as one of the world’s most technically advanced centres in terms of its design.  

The United Arab Emirates, represented by GCAA, is an active member of the Council of the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) and its specialized committees. It is also a member of the Arab Civil Aviation Commission (ACAC) Executive Council, and currently H.E Saif Mohammed Al Suwaidi, Director General of GCAA.

Custom company description:
Abu Dhabi Aviation (ADA) stands out as a global leader in aviation, truly a UAE Champion on a World stage. ADA offers a comprehensive range of services for both military and civilian sectors, specialising in rotary and fixed-wing aircraft. The company’s expertise extends to maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) services, air cargo solutions, luxury travel, helicopter leasing, advanced aircraft simulator training, and technical training.
Abu Dhabi Aviation provides aviation services to a range of sectors, including offshore oil support, aerial construction, medical evacuation, and search and rescue. The company also offers MRO services for helicopters, delivering comprehensive maintenance, repair, and overhaul services for various helicopter models to ensure their optimal performance and safety. In addition, Abu Dhabi Aviation provides maintenance and overhaul services for fixed-wing aircraft, including narrow and wide-body jets and turboprops, catering to the needs of both civil and military aviation. The company also specialises in maintenance services for aircraft engines and components, ensuring reliability and extending the lifespan of aviation assets.
The company is certified by major OEMs such as Leonardo, Honeywell, Bell, Boeing, and Airbus, and holds approvals from leading regulatory bodies, including the GCAA, FAA, and EASA. With a dedicated workforce of 9,500, Abu Dhabi Aviation continues to set benchmarks in the aviation and related sectors.
ADA is part of the Abu Dhabi Aviation Group of companies along with AMMROC, GAL, ADATC, Maximus, Royal Jet, AWAS, Adaire & Etihad Engineering.

MIASCOR is a full aviation services provider in the Philippines. Founded in 1974, it offers its airline clients a complete suite of services ranging from below- and above-the wing services. Its core businesses are in ground handling, cargo handling and warehousing, and in-flight catering.
The company’s development saw expansion in its portfolio which now includes a wide range of ancillary services such as fixed base operations (FBO), into-plane refueling, manpower deployment, general sales agency (GSA) and training. Custom company location: Po Box 2723, Abu Dhabi Emirate 30036, United Arab Emirates
Custom contact location: Abu Dhabi Emirate, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
Abu Dhabi Aviation (ADA) stands out as a global leader in aviation, truly a UAE Champion on a World stage. ADA offers a comprehensive range of services for both military and civilian sectors, specialising in rotary and fixed-wing aircraft. The company’s expertise extends to maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) services, air cargo solutions, luxury travel, helicopter leasing, advanced aircraft simulator training, and technical training.
Abu Dhabi Aviation provides aviation services to a range of sectors, including offshore oil support, aerial construction, medical evacuation, and search and rescue. The company also offers MRO services for helicopters, delivering comprehensive maintenance, repair, and overhaul services for various helicopter models to ensure their optimal performance and safety. In addition, Abu Dhabi Aviation provides maintenance and overhaul services for fixed-wing aircraft, including narrow and wide-body jets and turboprops, catering to the needs of both civil and military aviation. The company also specialises in maintenance services for aircraft engines and components, ensuring reliability and extending the lifespan of aviation assets.
The company is certified by major OEMs such as Leonardo, Honeywell, Bell, Boeing, and Airbus, and holds approvals from leading regulatory bodies, including the GCAA, FAA, and EASA. With a dedicated workforce of 9,500, Abu Dhabi Aviation continues to set benchmarks in the aviation and related sectors.
ADA is part of the Abu Dhabi Aviation Group of companies along with AMMROC, GAL, ADATC, Maximus, Royal Jet, AWAS, Adaire & Etihad Engineering.

Apart from this, we also have our own CNC machines and material exported from Austria which allow us to manufacture seals of different sizes and no MOQ as well.
In March 2016, Sealtech.com Aviation Seals Mfg. Ltd (SCAS) successfully obtained the Parts Manufacturing Approval (HPMA), where our products can be installed on the aircraft registered in China, Hong Kong, and Macau, issued by the Hong Kong Civil Aviation Department (HKCAD) and became the first Hong Kong manufacturer that can be able to enter the aviation supply chain. In June 2017, SCAS obtained the Aviation Industry Quality Management System Certification included AS9100, AS9120 and ISO9001. This means that the management system, product design, production process, and quality assurance of SCAS have reached the international aviation industry level. In order to provide more and better choices for the aviation industry in the Greater China region, SCAS is committed to develop and produce high-value performance HPMA parts. Regarding future developments, SCAS is setting up an ISO/IEC17025 laboratory to facilitate product development and quality testing and we are applying for NADCAP to enter the OEM market.

Custom company location: Airport Road, Abu Dhabi Emirate, United Arab Emirates
Custom company description:
The General Civil Aviation Authority (GCAA) was created in 1996 by Federal Cabinet Decree (Law 4) to regulate Civil Aviation and provide designated aviation services with emphasis on safety and security and to strengthen the aviation industry within the UAE and its upper airspace. The main office is located in Abu Dhabi and the regional office is located in Dubai to serve the northern Emirates.

The GCAA, which is the sole authority for the control and regulation of civil aviation in the UAE, is responsible for the provision of en-route air navigation services and all aspects of flight safety. In late 2009, the GCAA opened its new Air Navigation Centre, The Sheikh Zayed Centre, which is considered the largest and busiest air traffic management facility in the Middle East as well as one of the world’s most technically advanced centres in terms of its design.  

The United Arab Emirates, represented by GCAA, is an active member of the Council of the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) and its specialized committees. It is also a member of the Arab Civil Aviation Commission (ACAC) Executive Council, and currently H.E Saif Mohammed Al Suwaidi, Director General of GCAA.

Custom company location: 4090 Southwest 30th Ave, Hollywood, FL 33312, United States
Custom company description: SEAL Aviation performs Aircraft Fuel Leak Repair, Non-Destructive Testing and Airframe Structural Repairs anywhere in the world. We believe no job is too small or too ambitious. SEAL Aviation uses a 'one stop shop' concept that allows a maintenance facility to use SEAL Aviation's capabilities of Fuel tank repair, Non-Destructive Testing, extensive parts inventory and Structural repairs together. For example, our fuel tank team can prepare the fuel tanks as the NDT team performs X-rays alongside the fuel tank technicians. If we find corrosion during the X-ray inspection, our Structural team can also assist with the repair of the corrosion. The structural team can then repair the corrosion with seamless coordination by taking advantage of SEAL Aviation's other services. By using the SEAL Aviation 'one stop shop' concept you save with less down time by having professional personnel from one company completing the entire repair.

Account Name: The Commercial Aviation Association of Southern Africa

Custom company description:
The Commercial Aviation Association of Southern Africa and is a non-profit organisation for its members, run by its members.
CAASA’s main aim is to represent the interests of its members and affiliated associations at local, national, and regional levels.  CAASA provides a platform for all its members, of the general commercial aviation industry to voice their concerns and participate in the affairs of the aviation sector.
It is representative – CAASA sits on a wide range of committees and bodies to monitor and influence legislation and policies
Campaigning – CAASA attempts to change situations or introduce new procedures to benefit the aviation industry
Monitoring – CAASA monitors changes in legislation and in the market place
Promotion – CAASA supports and promotes a variety of aviation organisations
Information – CAASA keeps its members advised on the latest information through various channels
CAASA is the umbrella organisation for eight associations, namely;
• The Airports and Aerodromes Association of Southern Africa
• The Association of Aviation Training Organisations of Southern Africa
• The Association of Aviation Maintenance Organisation of Southern Africa
• The Association of Southern African Aerospace Traders and Allied Industries
• The Helicopter Association of Southern Africa
• The Association of Non-Scheduled Operators
• The Commercial Unmanned Aircraft Association of SA
• The Association of Aviation Design Organisations
• The Aerospace Quality & Safety Association of Southern Africa

Custom company description: Honiball Aviation Auditing is an aviation company dedicated to cater for all your aviation auditing and consulting needs. We conduct internal and external Part 121, 127, 135, 136, 141, 145, as well as safety audits. We can also manage your entire operation through tailor-made electronic Aviation Quality Assurance Management Systems. Our lead auditor and founder, Thomas Honiball, is an IOSA-qualified auditor with extensive auditing experience. He has successfully established operations offices for- and has guided many happy clients through the process of obtaining initial accreditation from the Civil Aviation Authority. Honiball Aviation Auditing, through our professional consultation and advisory services, can lead you through your entire initial operator accreditation. Founded in 1999, Starlite Aviation Group is a trusted global provider of helicopter and fixed-wing aviation services. Licensed by the Kenya Civil Aviation Authority and based at Wilson Airport in Nairobi, Bluebird Aviation is the leading provider for scheduled, non-scheduled and ad-hoc air charter services within the Eastern and Central African region and beyond.

Custom company location: 999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Montreal, Quebec h3c 5h7, Canada
Custom company description:
The Regional Aviation Safety Group – Pan America (RASG-PA) was established in November 2008 to use the framework provided by the ICAO Global Aviation Safety Plan (GASP) and the Global Aviation Safety Roadmap (GASR) to support the establishment and operation of a performance based aviation safety system in the Pan American Region.
RASG-PA serves as regional cooperative for integrating global, regional, national, and industry efforts in continuing to enhance aviation safety in the Region. RASG-PA eliminates duplication of effort through the establishment of cooperative regional safety initiatives and activities. This coordinated approach significantly reduces both financial and human resource burdens on States and allows for the delivery of measurable safety improvements.
Vision
 
The RASG-PA vision is to remain ahead of any risks to commercial aviation, and to collaborate towards achieving the highest level of safety in the Pan American Region.
 
Mission
 
The RASG-PA mission is to reduce fatality risk in commercial aviation by ensuring prioritization, coordination and implementation of data-driven safety enhancement initiatives in the Pan American Region through the active involvement of all civil aviation stakeholders.
If you want to know all our members, you can consult the following link: https://www.icao.int/RASGPA/Pages/Members.aspx

Custom company description:
Astral Aviation is a licensed cargo airline that acquired its Air Operators Certificate (AoC) and Air Service License (ASL) from the Kenya Civil Aviation Authority in 2001, and was subsequently designated as a cargo airline, by the Ministry of Transport of the Republic of Kenya in November 2006.
Flying the blue skies of Africa for 22 years, Astral Aviation provides reliable and cost-effective airfreight solutions using a combination of schedule and charter flights within its Intra-African, Middle East, Asian and European Network.
Astral operates a fleet of F27 (5 tons), DC9F (15 tons), B727-200F (22 tons), B757F (30 Tons), B767-200F (42 Tons) and B747-400F (110 Tons) within
its Intra-African, Middle East, Asian and European network which is connected via the Hubs of Nairobi, Dubai, Johannesburg and Liege.
Within its intra-African network, which  comprises of 50 destinations, Astral operates a combination of scheduled and adhoc charters along with value-added leasing services. Its interline agreements with over 40 Interline Partners; along with preferential agreements with the leading global and local freight forwarders; and partnerships with over 25 global GSA’s, facilitate the consolidation of cargoes at the freighter-friendly Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, Dubai, Johannesburg and Liege Airport.

So the airline decided on this “no frills” model as this has been successful in other parts of the world as seen with Ryan Air and Easy Jet in Europe and the United States of America respectively. We are the first low cost airline in this region as the only other low cost carriers in Africa are found in South Africa serving domestic routes. (SA) is a key Indian player in high-technology products for avionics and military applications, rugged displays, cockpit displays and equipment for military and commercial platforms. Samtel Avionics straddles the entire value chain from design, development, manufacture, testing, qualification, repair & maintenance to obsolescence management of avionics products and equipment. Its products and services include Multi-Function Displays, Smart Multi-Function Displays, Displays for commercial aircraft, Head Up Displays, Helmet Mounted Sight Displays, Automated Test Equipment, Multifunction Indicators: 3ATI & 4ATI, Optronics, Rugged displays for Land, Naval and Airborne platforms, Built-to-print/Built-to-Specs manufacturing, MRO services, and Obsolescence Management.

Samtel HAL Display Systems Ltd. The Samtel-HAL JV already enjoys the unique distinction of being the first public-private partnership in defence avionics space in India to indigenously design, qualify and serial produce multifunction displays which are currently flying on Su-30 MKI.

Samtel Thales Avionics is a Joint Venture between Samtel Avionics and Thales. Samtel Thales Avionics brings Thales's technological expertise to India as part of Thales's strategy of partnering with leading industry players around the world. The JV develops, customizes, manufactures, sells and maintains Helmet Mounted Sight & Display (HMSD), Optronics and other Avionics systems for the Indian market. Custom company description:
The Skyway Aviation Handling Company PLC (SAHCO) is a Public Liability Company, incorporated as an Aviation Ground Handling Services Provider under the Nigerian Companies and Allied Matters Act of 1990.
SAHCO, formerly known as Skypower Aviation Handling Company Limited, was carved out of the liquidated Nigeria Airways Limited as part of the Nigerian Federal Ministry of Aviation’s Reform of 1996. On the 23rd of December 2009, SAHCO was handed over to the Sifax Group by the Federal Government of Nigeria, after a keenly contested privatization in which Sifax Group came first as the preferred bidder with the sum of N5.52 billion Naira. The company was listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange on the 23rd of April 2019.
Skyway Aviation Handling Company PLC, with its new public sector management composition and orientation has kicked off the development of business models geared towards ushering in efficient and speedy service delivery. SAHCO is RA3 and ISAGO certified and has invested in personnel development, state-of-the-art equipment, fleet replacement, and massive infrastructural development.
The duties of SAHCO involves all the actions that takes place from the time an aircraft touches down on the tarmac to the time it is airborne, also ensuring that Ground Handling assignment is carried out in an efficient, speedy and safe manner, while deploying the right tools.

Custom company location: 216 24th Main Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560102, India
Custom company description:
AVGARDE is a radio frequency and wireless technology focused deeptech startup building an AI-driven object sensing platform for low-altitude airspace management. With the proliferation of drones, AVGARDE is reimagining wireless technologies to innovate the next generation products for the drone airspace and allied operations. 
The company’s DeepSense platform addresses complex challenges presented by drones/UAVs in terms of their operational environment which needs to be managed efficiently and effectively to ensure the safety of aviation, public, operators and other stakeholders. The platform has various applications across multiple market segments, including airports airspace safety, critical infrastructure protection, drone fleet operations, unmanned traffic management, security monitoring, aerospace and defence, amongst others.
Currently, the DeepSense platform has three product lines –  (1) DroneSafe - an AI-enabled Counter Unmanned Aerial System (C-UAS) to detect, classify, mitigate and report aerial risks/threats from drones, UAVs and other aerial objects; (2) DIWAR (Drone Intrusion Wall and Repulsion System) - an all-band GPS Jammer for tackling drones and inhibiting its airborne motions; and (3) BirdsEye - an intelligent Bird Detection and Monitoring Radar (BDMR) for dual-use aviation safety and preventing Bird Aircraft Strike Hazard (BASH). 
Founded in India as a private limited company, AVGARDE has offices in Bangalore, the world’s fastest growing tech hub, and Guwahati in the northeast frontier region, alongside partners across India and overseas. AVGARDE has incubation and research partnerships with some of the top institutions, including Indian Institute of Science (IISc) Bangalore, and Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Guwahati.

Starlite Aviation Group: Leaders in Global Aviation
Founded in 1999, Starlite Aviation Group is a trusted global provider of helicopter and fixed-wing aviation services. Headquartered at Hangar 123, Virginia Airport in Durban North, South Africa, we operate across Africa and internationally, delivering specialized aviation solutions in diverse and challenging environments.
Our comprehensive service portfolio includes Helicopter Operations, Fixed-Wing Charter, Humanitarian Support, Offshore Services, MEDEVAC, Aerial Firefighting, Search and Rescue, Aviation Training, Aircraft Maintenance, and Aerosales. With a diverse fleet and a highly skilled team, we tailor our services to meet the unique needs of our clients.
We proudly serve government agencies, international organizations, energy companies, and private corporations. Safety and reliability are at the core of our operations, with all aircraft maintained to rigorous international standards at our SACAA-approved facilities.
Starlite is committed to delivering exceptional aviation services while prioritizing safety, operational efficiency, and client satisfaction. From supporting humanitarian aid missions in remote regions to offshore transport and life-saving medical evacuations, we bring professionalism and expertise to every mission.
With over two decades of experience, Starlite Aviation Group continues to set the standard for aviation excellence, making a difference wherever we fly.
Learn more at www.starliteaviation.com.

Custom company description:
Five Forty Aviation Limited, commonly known as 540 is a Kenyan company which was established in 2005 and commenced operations in November 2006. Fly540 Aviation acquired a strategic partnership with the Lonrho Plc conglomerate.
Fly540 recognised there was need for a low cost carrier to meet the demand for value for money travel. So the airline decided on this “no frills” model as this has been successful in other parts of the world as seen with Ryan Air and Easy Jet in Europe and the United States of America respectively. We are the first low cost airline in this region as the only other low cost carriers in Africa are found in South Africa serving domestic routes. Our low cost airline business gives us the ability to offer travel at affordable prices which benefit our customer within Africa.
Our aircrafts are maintained by our very experienced engineers and technicians who have extensive training internationally and locally in addition to having a wide experience and are licensed to practice by the Kenya Civil Aviation Authority (KCAA), Uganda civil aviation (CAA) as well as the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO).
The company employs a dynamic service oriented team, who are well trained to offer the highest levels of service to our customers. The senior management team comprises of highly qualified Kenyan staff with many years’ experience with both international and domestic airlines, in the region and overseas.

Custom company description:
PIA Solutions has been active in India for 16 years, directly or through our Indian subsidiary (PIA Consultancy & Engineering Pvt. Ltd.), offering diverse services such as business development advisory, project management, EPC projects, Construction management, logistics, and more.
Owned and operated by a joint Israeli-Indian team, we offer a deep understanding of the very different psyches which drive the Israeli and Indian business environments. Over the years, we developed a proven method for amalgamating the two. Thus, we can offer both "boots on-ground" in India, as well as guidance in bridging the cultural gaps.
PIA has a well-established business network in both countries, in various domains. We deliver our customers the support required in their activities, ranging from evaluating target markets, client / vendor identification, techno-commercial evaluations and discussions, support of negotiations and more, followed by project planning, ground supervision, monitoring and management on behalf of the Client.
Bottom line – 
We offer our clients a comprehensive end to end solution specifically tailored to their needs, ranging from complete project execution through project management, and up to consultancy only regarding activities in India.
The uniqueness of our solution comes from our vast Indo-Israeli business experience. 
We have permanent presence in India allowing fast and efficient response time to any arising matter. 
Our clients enjoy the benefit of a deeper and wider activity base in India, while costs stay far below the alternative of manpower relocation or frequent travel costs. 
We offer and deliver better and more efficient control of activities compared to "remote control" management from Israel, as well as an increase in effective work hours in Israel – due to our service, companies face lower travel needs, and the Israeli personnel can get many more productive work hours in Israel.

Custom company description:
The Skyway Aviation Handling Company PLC (SAHCO) is a Public Liability Company, incorporated as an Aviation Ground Handling Services Provider under the Nigerian Companies and Allied Matters Act of 1990.
SAHCO, formerly known as Skypower Aviation Handling Company Limited, was carved out of the liquidated Nigeria Airways Limited as part of the Nigerian Federal Ministry of Aviation’s Reform of 1996. On the 23rd of December 2009, SAHCO was handed over to the Sifax Group by the Federal Government of Nigeria, after a keenly contested privatization in which Sifax Group came first as the preferred bidder with the sum of N5.52 billion Naira. The company was listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange on the 23rd of April 2019.
Skyway Aviation Handling Company PLC, with its new public sector management composition and orientation has kicked off the development of business models geared towards ushering in efficient and speedy service delivery. SAHCO is RA3 and ISAGO certified and has invested in personnel development, state-of-the-art equipment, fleet replacement, and massive infrastructural development.
The duties of SAHCO involves all the actions that takes place from the time an aircraft touches down on the tarmac to the time it is airborne, also ensuring that Ground Handling assignment is carried out in an efficient, speedy and safe manner, while deploying the right tools.

Custom company description:
Lufthansa Aviation Training Switzerland Ltd. (LAT CH) provides quality training and instruction for commercial pilots, cabin crew, technical staff and ground personnel. With its vast airline training expertise and decades of on-the-job experience, LAT Switzerland has developed a customer base that extends to several international airlines, as well as further major service providers. The company and its courses also enable established trainers and instructors to gain further qualifications.
LAT CH is an Approved Training Organization (ATO) including type rating training, whose courses are approved by the Swiss Federal Office of Civil Aviation (FOCA) in accordance with the rules and regulations of the European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA), as well as by many other aviation authorities. 
With its state-of-the-art facilities, which range from computer-based training to various full-flight simulators and cabin emergency trainers, LAT's training environment is as close to reality as it is possible to get. The company also offers web-based options for a number of its training courses and for various aircraft types. 
Swiss Aviation Training Ltd. was renamed to Lufthansa Aviation Training Switzerland Ltd. and is part of Lufthansa Aviation Training Group since January 2017. In early 2017, Lufthansa Aviation Training Group is as a powerful end-to-end training provider in the European market. Our headquarters are located in Munich.

Custom company description:
In the early 1980’s, Kuwait airways identified the need for a separate company to undertake many of its ground handling functions. In addition, the provision of a flight kitchen operating to first class international standards at Kuwait International Airport was seen as essential for the future growth of the airport. Kuwait Airways therefore established in 1981 a wholly owned subsidiary Kuwait Aviation Services Company (KASCO) - to meet these needs.
The kitchen established by KASCO was only the first brick that has grown bit by bit into such a huge company designed especially to meet the needs of its customers. Today, after more than thirty year of operation, in addition to its flight kitchen, KASCO is operating Kuwait International Airport’s restaurants and cafeterias, supervising the First Class and Business Class Lounges (Dasman), overseeing V.V.I.P. services, and managing the food and beverage operation of the airport transit hotel.
KASCO started providing catering services to local market under the name of KASCO Gourmet. This project specializes in providing catering services, such as buffets and banquets, as well as meal plans for individuals, private institutions, and some governmental sectors. We also focus on providing V.I.P. and V.V.I.P. privileges and services to our customers.
As another indication of KASCO’s aim to widen its activities, KASCO has established the Hospitals Catering Services in 2003, Our catering service provides reassurance to our clients that meals are of the highest quality and provenance to ensure, the maximum satisfaction of their patients, visitors and staff.

Custom company location: 2c Blok, Sariyer, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
Custom company description:
Tibah Airports Operation Co. operates Prince Mohammad Bin Abdulaziz Intl. Airport in Madinah, Saudi Arabia. 
The Government of Saudi Arabia realized from the outset the importance of the private sector as an economic development partner, and the civil aviation sector is ambitious; having ideal investment factors. The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is a country with an important geographical location and a unique religious significance in the Muslim world. Furthermore, due to its economic strength and openness, investments in the sector are attracted to the belief that they will be successfully developed. Given the importance and the role of the air transport sector in the service of pilgrims and visitors to the Prophet's mosque, the government was directed to transform Prince Mohammad Bin Abdulaziz Intl. Airport in Madinah to a world-class airport. In this context, international participation was ensured in this project, the first Public-Private Partnership (PPP) project in KSA; with an ambitious plan to modernize and expand the airport with private sector participation under the long-term concession. 
Ten international, regional, and local firms submitted qualification applications. Four consortia ultimately submitted bids on 8 August 2011. Technical bids were evaluated and scored before opening financial bids. After determining a final score, Tibah was awarded the concession.
On 29/10/2011 the Build, Transfer, and Operate Agreement (BTO), was signed between the GACA and Tibah to initialize the first airport project in the Middle East to be fully built under PPP.
The project was inaugurated on 2nd July 2015 by The Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques King Salman bin Abdulaziz al Saud, in the presence of other major dignitaries from the kingdom. The $1.2 billion expansion plan consists of a three-level terminal covering over 156,940 square meters with 16 aircraft stands and boarding bridges.

We Innovate & integrate drone solutions and services into scalable real-world applications that benefit enterprises and the community at large while making sure authenticity and clarity are central to making decisions that save time, money and lives.
Throughout the lifecycle of any largescale projects and assets in sectors such as roads and highways, powerlines, pipelines, mines and even agriculture we use drone based solutions to enable three primary stages: Planning, construction and maintenance.
Planning: Our web-based analytical platforms transform survey grade drone maps, digital elevation models into rich high-resolution geospatial models and information systems that can be used for detailed project reports, feasibility studies and project planning.
Monitoring: We help you compare the rate of project progress over time and identifying bottlenecks where project management is required. Through solutions that make use of near real-time analysis enabled by drone videography and photography, we ensure that regardless of the scale every stakeholder has the relevant context to make the right decisions.
Inspection: Drone-based analytical solutions can help asset owners and maintenance teams accurately understand defects with information layers such as high-resolution drone videography, thermal analysis, and other asset lifecycle modelling tools.

Charter Connect is a trusted air charter broker based in South Africa, dedicated to transforming business travel across Africa. We specialise in creating flexible, direct, and cost-effective private charter flight solutions that overcome the common frustrations of commercial air travel on the continent.
In many parts of sub-Saharan Africa, flying commercially often means indirect routes, multiple stopovers, long delays, and missed business opportunities. At Charter Connect, we believe there’s a better way to travel. By understanding the unique needs of business travellers, we offer smarter, faster, and more convenient options that help you get where you need to be — without the stress.
We work with corporate travel managers, travel management companies, and individual professionals to organise tailored charter flights. By grouping travellers with similar routes and coordinating aircraft through our reliable network of charter operators, we deliver direct flights that save time, reduce hassle, and keep costs competitive.
Whether you travel regularly for business or occasionally need access to remote destinations, our goal is to make every journey simple, safe, and efficient. From your initial request to final arrival, our friendly and responsive team handles every detail with care and professionalism. We match you with the right aircraft for your needs, offering comfort, convenience, and reliability every step of the way.
If you’re looking to take control of your business travel, avoid unnecessary delays, and enjoy a smooth, seamless flying experience, we’re here to help. Visit our website to complete a Client Travel Profile and tell us about your travel needs. At Charter Connect, we make flying for business in Africa easier, faster, and far more enjoyable.

Custom company location: E-178 East of Kailash, New Delhi, 110065, India
Custom company description:
Aviaxpert is one of the leading ground handling service provider in India. Established in 2006, the
company has over the period of time gained the trust and confidence of all the major airline operators
in India and has become a brand to reckon with in the airline industry. More than 2000 diligent and
committed human resource comprise the Aviaxpert workforce which is trained to deliver “excellence in
service”. Aviaxpert is an ISO: 9001:2008 certified company and is a member of IATA ground handling
council and Airport Service Association (ASA). In its pursuit of excellence the company has been
adjudged as the “safety partner of Delhi International Airport” for airside management and safety.
Armed with an experience of over a decade in the aviation sector, Aviaxpert today has a network which
spreads across 8 airports in India and turns around 75 flights a day at the IGI airport New Delhi. The
client list of the company is in itself a testimony to its service standards. The current and past clients of
Aviaxpert include Vistara, Air India, Go Air, Jet Airways, Spice Jet, Air Asia, Emirates, Etihad Airways,
Kuwait Airlines, Air Mauritius, Drukair, Nepal Airlines, Philippine Airlines, and PIA.
Known for its prompt and efficient service, Aviaxpert provides comprehensive ground handling services
along with leasing of ground support equipment. Services like Flight handling training, Disruption
handling, Departure control system, Airport and metro passenger check-in, Lost and found baggage
service, Transfer/transit handling, Excess baggage, Arrival handling are the company’s area of expertise
. From the year 2006 to 2012, Aviaxpert was GHA for erstwhile Kingfisher Airlines at IGI International
Airport, New Delhi and turned around 120 flights a day for them. It also provided meet and assist
(MAAS) and PRM (Passengers with restricted mobility) service to the airline. As a GHA, Aviaxpert also
provided meet and assist (MAAS), valet and PRM services to Air India through their subsidiary AI SATS
since 2007 till 2016. The equipment used by the company in the ground handling services, adhere to
the IATA specifications and are procured from world renowned brands. With no compromises on the
service quality, Aviaxpert ensures that their equipments are upgraded from time to time thereby
guaranteeing latest technology in services to its clients. The company will also be ISAGO (IATA Safety
Audit for Ground Operations) compliant soon.
While providing Ground handling services Aviaxpert stays committed to the safety and comfort
of the passengers. The airport PRM service Known “Airport Kruz” is the first of its kind endeavor
which ensures swift and safe movement of the differently abled passengers on motorized
wheel chairs. To make it easy for both the passenger and the staff to move up and down the
aircraft stairway safely, Stair climbers with powerful mechanism have been introduced. With
the help of latest technology and a committed team, Aviaxpert has developed an assured
system of prioritizing, scheduling and delivering wheelchair assistance with a user friendly
interface for the passengers. Well groomed, educated, trained and courteous staff is employed
as wheel chair assistants for the PRM service. To safeguard the interests of the passengers and
the airlines the company has in place a comprehensive insurance policy.
With the new PRM service, Axiaxpert has further strengthened itself as an innovative, reliable
and proactive service provider.
Aviaxpert is a driven by passionate team which is committed to offer "Nothing but the Best" to its clients.

Established in 1956 by two brothers keen to leave their impact on the Emirati market, Omeir Bin Youssef Group first started out as Khalifa and Omeir Travel Agency and was home to a modest four employees. The company’s first business forays spanned the travel industry with services such as booking, airline representation, cargo handling and airport ground-handling services. By 1967, the company had already set on its path to expansion, acquiring British Petroleum and becoming sole distributors of brands such as Rothmans, Palmolive and Colgate.
Over the years, the company’s financial success and independence has enabled it to stay true to its vision and values. Founded on the noble pillars of passion, reliability, credibility and charity, the group continues to look for those same values in its employees, partners and collaborators, privileging the founders’ morals first and foremost.  By building on its growth and seeking investment opportunities, the company continues to expand and grow its portfolio, inviting partnerships and improving its own efficiency and productivity.
The group has been granted a number of awards and accolades and has crossed many milestones along the way. Today, Omeir Bin Youssef group has become one of the most renowned groups on the UAE market, with a long history of success in the sector, and has recently launched offices in the USA and China. Custom company description:
Raphe mPhibr, Raphe in short, is a hi-tech aerospace company designing and manufacturing comprehensive & customised UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle) solutions, tested across terrains and weather conditions, with a million+ km traveled across India since 2017.
With 400+ employees, world-class research & manufacturing facilities, and bright young minds trained at MIT, Georgia Tech, IITs, NITs and more, our philosophy is to design and manufacture end-to-end solutions in-house, and across engineering fields, including Aerodynamics, Mechanical, Materials, Electronics, Software & AI.

Launched in 2013, JetSetGo has transformed the accessibility of private travel around India since its inception. From its Delhi HQ, and supported by bases in Mumbai, Hyderabad and Bengaluru, the company has been serving India's elite to fulfill their demanding and grueling travel requirements.
Our customers simply let us know where they need to go and when, and we get them there along with their specific needs and requests (ranging from meals to inflight entertainment to aircraft type and ground transportation links). We are able to satisfy these requirements due to the size and unique accessibility of our fleet, our experienced staff (back-end, front-end, ground staff and flight crew), and our unrivaled commitment to the entire travel experience.

Sky Shuttle offers swift point-to-point connectivity, both intra and inter city across the nation. Currently operating in-demand pain-point routes such as Juhu-Vapi, Juhu-Tarapur, Mumbai-Bengaluru, and Bhopal-Indore, Sky Shuttle has taken the fist step in revolutionising the Indian travel experience.

Our easy-to-use digital interfaces are backed up by our 24/7 customer care centre to ensure that domestic travel will never be a hassle again.

Custom company description:
At TECHEAGLE, we are building autonomous aerial systems for Quick Logistics, Public Safety & Defence to save & improve lives. 
Founded by IIT Kanpur alumni, TECHEAGLE started with a problem, not a product: How can essential goods like medicines or emergency supplies reach remote regions faster, without relying on unreliable roads or traditional logistics? That question sparked India’s drone logistics movement.
Today, TECHEAGLE is a full-stack deeptech company developing autonomous drone systems, spanning hardware, software, ground infra, and flight operations.
We serve four key sectors:
• Healthcare: Live BVLOS deliveries of medicines and vaccines across AIIMS and MoHFW corridors
• Quick Commerce: Fast, cost-effective last-mile and mid-mile delivery for e-commerce and quick commerce
• Public Safety: Real-time disaster response and emergency delivery in flood-prone and remote regions
• Defense: Tactical logistics and ISR-ready drones for national security and dual-use operations
Our systems are:
• BVLOS-compliant, field-tested, and DGCA-approved
• Designed and built in Bharat, optimized for diverse terrains
• Powered by our proprietary tech stack: FleetOS, Command Center, OMS, UTM-lite, and Payload Pods
• Deployed using a asset light model for easy partner integration and scale
With 500+ drones in the deployment pipeline and operations across 10+ Indian states, TECHEAGLE is laying the foundation for aerial infrastructure that enables speed, resilience, and autonomy at scale.
We are not just building drones. We are building the next layer of infrastructure, intelligence, and impact to serve lives, supply chains, and sovereignty.
Whether you're an investor, policymaker, partner, or builder: let's co- a future where autonomy lifts Bharat.
www.techeagle.in
info@techeagle.in
Headquartered in Gurugram | Operational Pan-India

Custom company location: Sifax Group Headquaters Pmb 21768 3rd Floor Ikeja Lagos State, 100242, Nigeria
Custom company description:
The Skyway Aviation Handling Company PLC (SAHCO) is a Public Liability Company, incorporated as an Aviation Ground Handling Services Provider under the Nigerian Companies and Allied Matters Act of 1990.
SAHCO, formerly known as Skypower Aviation Handling Company Limited, was carved out of the liquidated Nigeria Airways Limited as part of the Nigerian Federal Ministry of Aviation’s Reform of 1996. On the 23rd of December 2009, SAHCO was handed over to the Sifax Group by the Federal Government of Nigeria, after a keenly contested privatization in which Sifax Group came first as the preferred bidder with the sum of N5.52 billion Naira. The company was listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange on the 23rd of April 2019.
Skyway Aviation Handling Company PLC, with its new public sector management composition and orientation has kicked off the development of business models geared towards ushering in efficient and speedy service delivery. SAHCO is RA3 and ISAGO certified and has invested in personnel development, state-of-the-art equipment, fleet replacement, and massive infrastructural development.
The duties of SAHCO involves all the actions that takes place from the time an aircraft touches down on the tarmac to the time it is airborne, also ensuring that Ground Handling assignment is carried out in an efficient, speedy and safe manner, while deploying the right tools.
